Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in New York City”
Reviews.Author: Patricia Louise S
Reviews.Content: I love the Wolcott, you can't beat it for the price. We were lucky enough to get early check in, and they bumped us up from one room with two beds to two adjoining rooms with three beds and an open doorway between. The bedrooms and bathroom were spotlessly clean, fresh and charming, the beds were really comfortable. The Wolcott has a lovely old word charm. The manager allowed us to take a peek at the old ballroom which is being renovated, it's breathtaking, so ask if you can see it. I wish they would turn the ballroom into a restaurant/bar, I can't wait to see what il looks like when they're done. The staff is friendly and helpful, and morning muffins and coffee in the lobby is a nice touch. We'll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “WOLCOTT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: seanoporno
Reviews.Content: The Wolcott was in a prime location close to Times Square and provided a great stay for myself and my girlfriend who was celebrating her 30th birthday.The room was a junior suite and was more than adequate and spotless.The staff were helpful and we had a great stay.1 slight downer was a really loud noise at around 5am due to a faulty boiler i believe but plusses outweigh the one minuses,a great stay Sean

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel; Horrible Bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaB70
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a wonderful decor. When you walk through the doors, it's like stepping into another world. It's also perfectly located within walking distance of Times Square, Penn Station, Broadway, and fifth avenue. I loved our room. It was the only 3-person room I had ever seen! My only downside was the bathroom. It was small and cramped and the worst part was the tub. There was enamel missing in the tub and there was nothing to hold on to. Every time I took a shower I had to make a conscious effort to move in a way that would cause me to fall. Breakfast also left a lot to be desired. I mean for what we pay for it I expect more than coffee and muffins. I thought the hotel was great for what it was but I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: malhen
Reviews.Content: On entering the hotel my wife and I, on a four-day booking, were somewhat taken aback by the superb decor of the foyer - essentially baroque with impressive chandeliers and plush chairs. The theme is carried around the hotel, creating a most favourable first impression. Our room, a twin, was large and well presented with a huge T.V. offering most US channels with the option of paying for extras. Breakfast is not available (no dining room) but muffins and coffee are served free from 6.30 a.m. in the foyer. A safe was provided oin the room, offering that extra security. Location excellent, one block from the Empire State Building. Prices most competitive but beware of additional taxes imposed plus a hotel retainer deucted from credit card, refundable on final settlement. Staff obliging and helpful and a useful source of tourist information. We would happily return and can recommend wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Would book here again”
Reviews.Author: LebboLass
Reviews.Content: Can't complain about anything this hotel offered. We have stayed in many hotels in mid and upper Manhattan and this one we would definitely use again. Comfy beds, coffee and pastries for breakfast, decent size rooms with bath/shower. Really helpful staff. Theater booking service. Internet. Central location for getting about. We really warmed to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you want to visit the big apple on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: Rachesj29x
Reviews.Content: I would say my week long stay at this hotel was average, after all most of your time should be spent seeing the sights than worrying over little things! Fantastic location just a few blocks down from the Empire State and a short walk to Madison Square too. I am not a fussy traveller at all, but despite being a good size, the room was incredibly hot in the night with a very loud heating system! Also be careful of the nylon bed sheets which gave me and my friend several static shocks when taking it off the bed! You get muffins/tea/coffee included for breakfast, but if like me you like a big breakfast then I'd recommend to head out, there is plenty of choice nearby. If visiting again I would probably book somewhere a bit smarter but if you literally just want a base in a central location then this hotel is fine.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: LINDAWoodburn_Ky
Reviews.Content: me, my Mom and sister decided to take a trip to NYC, I looked at all the hotels for days and days and finally decided on this one, I am so glad I did. We had the room that has 3 twin beds and the rooms are very nice and the beds and pillows - very comfortable. The hotel is close to anything and everything you want to do. I highly recommend this to anyone wanting a nice but not expensive place to stay. the staff was very nice from the time we checked in. The mornings they have homemade muffins and hot fresh coffee in the lobby. I give this place a 10!

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel in convenient position!”
Reviews.Author: sue c
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I have just returned from our first stay in New York, staying at the Wolcott. We were very impressed with this hotel. When you first walk through the door, it has got a wonderful lobby which has been recently restored. Our room which was at the front of the hotel 10 floors up was spacious and very clean and had a wonderful of the empire state building. It was pretty cold outside but the Wolcott Hotel was lovely and warm. In the morning there were compiimentary home made muffins, tea and coffee for guests to enjoy which was a bonus. In all, it was a lovely hotel, had everything we could have wished for and was excellent value for money and convenient for all the sites. Would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent except for staff stuff up”
Reviews.Author: keljam731
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Wolcott Hotel for 13 nights for our first stop on a month long trip to America, we arrived and checked in, we were pretty excited to be in New York as this was our first overseas trip for both of us, the staff memeber checking us in wasnt feeling our excitement though. The location for the hotel is excellent, 5 minute walk to Madison Square Garden, 20 mins to Central Park, 10 mins to Time Square. Supermarket and pharmacy only a 5 min walk up 5th Avenue, perfect. Found the room to be quite spacious for New York City, we had seen some of the reviews before going over and were expecting it to be alot smaller than it was. Nice walk in robe with a safe, had a desk and a lounge chair, and bathroom was small but convenient. My fiance had emailed before we went over and requested a fridge in our room, with a reply that one would be provided for our stay free of charge if one was available. (we thought being the slow period over there that there would be no problem), when we arrived in our room there was no fridge. We went out to get some dinner and went past the front desk to ask if a fridge was available and the guy was quite nice about it and by the time we got back to our room there was one there. There was one problem with our stay though, we had been out exploring the amazing sights New York has to offer and had done some shopping and got some lunch and were pretty keen to go back to our room and relax for a few hours before going to a NBA game, went to put our key card in and it wouldnt work, tried it a few times thinking we were just putting it in too quickly but it still wouldnt work, so my Fiancee went down to the front desk to see what was wrong only to be told that we had to check out, he was a little suprised at it was only day 8 of our 13 night stay?! After the man from the front desk telling him that we had only checked in for 8 days, my Fiancee replied with "im pretty sure we have checked in for 13 nights, I can get our travel documents but they are in our room, would you like me to go get them" the gentleman replied with "oh no no its okay ill just go check whats going on", he came back and provided him with 2 new key cards for the rest of our stay, very appologetic for the incompetence of mr non excitment. The only other problem we had was that because the hotel thought that we had checked out, once we got the new key cards and got back into our room we put the lock on the door as we do with any hotel room we stay in, and house keeping tried to come in the room. Not there fault at all as they were only coming to clean the room as they had thought we checked out, so we just explained what had happened and she was very understanding. All in all, a good budget hotel, great location, despite what other people on here have said, we didnt have much street noise, I think what some people forget is that it is New York City so it never stops, so expecting to stay in the heart of the city and have no noise it crazy. Most of the staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Midtown location - good value”
Reviews.Author: Clembo1957
Reviews.Content: The Wolcott hotel is one of New Yorks hidden secrets despite its Midtown location. I first stayed at The Wolcott in 1998 when it was one of the cheapest hotels in the area, 2012 was my third stay at the Hotel and decor wise it doesn't seem to have changed a great deal during the intervening years, the hotel as the air of having seen better days but its still good value for money. The Wolcott is located on West 31st St between Broadway and 5th Avenue and is in easy walking distance of The Empire State Building, Madison Square Garden, Times Sq and the theater district. The hotel lobby gives the hotel a slight hint of grandeur, the rooms are adequately furnished and clean, the bathroom had a toilet, bath and shower. My overnight weekday stay cost $140 for a double room. New York hotel staff don't seem to be the friendliest so don't expect service with a smile when checking in. Ideally located, good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend at the Hotel Wolcott”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanSoul
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hotel Wolcott in NYC for a few reasons, namely triple accommodation, location and price and it came through on all counts. We were a party of three women who wanted to share a room but all wanted our own space which was difficult to find. However, the Wolcott offered triple accommodation comprising a large twin room with an adjoining single annex which was great. We found the location on 31st Street near 5th Avenue was convenient and not too far from Times Square, the Port Authority transport hub and the shopping. The rooms are a little dated but good value for the price, although internet access was a tad costly. The hotel offered free tea, coffee and fresh muffins in the lobby in the morning which was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “International Sales CEO for Metals Gift wares ,Handicrafts , Gift wares ,etc”
Reviews.Author: Jahangir A
Reviews.Content: I am staying in Hotel wolcott 4w 31 st Ny Ny , the best kind of owner Mr Scott , and excellent staff , mostly everything nearby Hotel, cool and nice atmosphere , its like home away home , not conjusted , enough space , as per my experience in NY area in Manhattan

Reviews.Title: “the price has to be right to stay here”
Reviews.Author: jchd
Reviews.Content: although in the center of manhattan, the rooms are very antiquated, and the TV might be considered obsolete by now, and it did not work, I got charged $25 for a movie I never saw. The first junior suite I was given was so dismal I had to change, and even then the improvement was inconsequential.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: SLasn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during April 2011 for five nights. The location is perfect, walking distance to all major attractions. Hotel is clean, staff are friendly and you will struggle to find a hotel that is better value for money. Recommend highly and would stay again with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “A good value, good location, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: Marvelous_Travelers
Reviews.Content: The Wolcott Hotel is dated and bit rough around the edges, but for the price it is hard to beat. We checked in with no trouble and the room was spacious. The location is right near Madison Square Garden and the Murray Hill area which makes it great. The price is why you stay here. Always a good price for NYC and close to the Megabus bus stops. We literally walked from the Megabus to the hotel in 5 minutes. Couldn't have been easier.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel - cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: CJZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wolcott a couple of times because it suited our budget and we wouldn’t have gone back if it wasn't clean and in a great location just off 5th Ave. The two lifts are very slow and it appears that once you're room is on a floor above the 6ht floor you have problem with your shower's temperature and pressure. On our first trip it was a matter of get in and out quickly for fear of scolding yourself or freezing, the earlier the better because once others started waking up there was too much pressure on their system. We went back the second time due to cost and location, despite the water issues - we had those tricks down pat. However on the second stay they put us neat a stairwell which was not only a fire exit but a connection to other rooms - it was incredibly noisy with the door slamming shut frequently so we were moved to the second floor in a quieter room and this is when we really noticed how fabulous the water pressure and temperature was on the lower levels at any time of the day. All in all if you're on a budget and not fussed about the old decor it was clean and accessible - just ask for a low floor!

Reviews.Title: “FOR $60 A NIGHT .... woth it”
Reviews.Author: TatianaMR
Reviews.Content: great location! a bit old, a little noisy heating and i think i felt it like a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “first trip to New York”
Reviews.Author: paintednails4
Reviews.Content: We stayed 12-16 Jan 2012 and we were impressed by hotel. The staff were helpful and friendly when we arrived we were booked into a twin room so called reception and they changed straight away. Had couple of problems with safe in room and again sorted within minutes. Ideal location just round corner from Empire State and the tube station. We found getting around no problem at all. We asked for directions and Michael on Reception was very helpful and pointed us in right direction. The rooms them selfs are small which i understand is normal in New York the bed was great very comfy the shower was good too and always hot water. May need decorating but to be honest didnt spend any time in room really. My only complaint would be no tea/coffee making facititys in room :( but dunking donuts across road so got tea from there. The tea and coffee in morning with muffins are free and lovely. The hotel is nice inside pity the old ball room is no longer there as looked lovely on the photos. Overall we had great time even though was very cold but hey ho it was january. Would stay again and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thomas P
Reviews.Content: This is an ideal spot for tourists on a budget. Conveniently located near some tourists attractions (Empire State Building), shops and a subway about a block or 2 away. Don't expect it to be the most luxurious stay you'll ever have - but it's more than enough for those who will be sightseeing all day in any case, and only need a bed to crash when the feet can't walk anymore...

Reviews.Title: “budget hotel but very good”
Reviews.Author: DAVEYNeEngland
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the wolcott around midnight (we should have been there around 13.30) but due to very high winds flights were delayed and so on and so on, but the staff at the Wolcott were very sympathetic and soon had us in our room. Sad to say with no luggage as our airline lost it but the following day the hotel receptionist gave it her all to try and find it.(eventualy 2 days later it was delivered) The hotel is 100 years old which showed as you walked into reception chandaliers period pillars, mirrored walls, gold plaster work and cornices, great wow factor. Rooms were a bit small, but kept very clean, and towels etc changed daily. There was no restraunt in the hotel, but a nice touch was hot beverages and fresh muffins at breakfast time. The hotel is situated very centrally and no where was too far to walk. So if your going to NYC this hotel will be as usable as many of the others.

Reviews.Title: “Good affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Assaad_Andary
Reviews.Content: definitely a good and clean hotel at an average price where everyone can stay during a trip to new york city. it is near the metro station, empire state building, times square so you don't have to worry about transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Bad booking experience”
Reviews.Author: SQFlyer72
Reviews.Content: I did not stay in this hotel but would like to share my bad booking experience with this hotel. I made a booking (which allows free cancellation within the stated period) with this hotel through Booking.com and had to cancel the booking due to a change in the travel dates. The cancellation was made more than 5 months prior to the first day of arrival, well before the last day of cancellation of not incurring a cancellation charge. I received the cancellation email from Booking.com and thought that everything had been settled properly. However, 5 months later, i was shocked to see that this hotel has made a charge to my credit card. I called up Booking.com to confirm that i have cancelled the reservation as per the cancellation policy and they acknowledged my confirmation and asked me to provide my credit card statement so that they can liaise with the hotel to refund the wrong charge back to me. After several weeks of phone calls and email exchange with various staff from Booking.com, including those from customer satisfaction department, i was shocked to be informed that the hotel had refused to make the refund to me, citing that i have made a claim to them through my credit card company, which i had not done so. In the end, it was Booking.com who made the refund to me when i informed them that there was no claim made by my credit card company. I was utterly disappointed by the response from this hotel's management and would like to advise anyone who wants to book this hotel to make sure that they are sure about their stay so that they won't be ripped off by the hotel in case they made a cancellation as it is not cheap to stay in midtown Manhattan New York.

Reviews.Title: “Staying Here? No problem with room 606...”
Reviews.Author: bowens_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in November 2011 for 5 nights. The holiday was booked for us so we did not choose the Wolcott ourselves, & having looked at the reviews we felt understandably nervous before we arrived. The location is brilliant (as many people have said already), the room that we had was basic but clean and comfortable and the staff might not win any charm awards, but they were always helpful and polite. The coffee and muffins that you can have for breakfast is simple, but its decent quality and a nice start to the day - most tourists in NY will be taking the opportunity to eat out as much as possible so if you are not keen there plenty of options outside. I get the impression that some of the hotel has been refurbed (good reviews) but the rest hasn't (poor reviews!) but I can assure you that room 606 is absolutely fine and a great base for a few days of exploring! Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot for a Quick Trip!”
Reviews.Author: mgp19083
Reviews.Content: Good location, 31st and 5th, with easy access to subway and/or Penn Center for quick travel up and down Manhatten. Easy walk to Madison Square area and Times Square area. Hotel needs to improve lighting in rooms and bathroom is basic, but certainly functional. Junior suite is definately worth the extra cost as it adds space, closet, and extra TV. Phone did not work but most folks today have cellular. Had to pay for WIFI which I did not understand as most places today offer for free when you stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: colbox
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old and in desperate need of updating. Poor ventilation in the rooms. The bathroom was the smallest I have ever been on. I definitely do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel very well located”
Reviews.Author: b-noy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty much old (nice entrance, but the hallways and rooms look pretty tired, they should consider some renovation!). The main advantage of this hotel is the location: walk-distance from Macy's, Times Square, etc. Rooms were okay, but looks really ugly. Two other points that would made spend a nicer experience: offering a free wifi (was $25 for 3 days from a third-party) and having a parking spot.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price - quality at good location”
Reviews.Author: Carolien_be
Reviews.Content: Just spend a few days in this hotel, very conveniently located on 31st en 5th and offering interesting conditions. When you step in the lobby you think you step back into the lavish 19th century with a spacy and beautiful adorned lobby with impressive chandeliers. Our room (3 people) was very spacious, with a seperate corner for the 3rd person with desk and 23nd TV set. The bathroom was mall but had all necesseties, even a tub We were lucky and our room was very quiet. Spoke to someone who had a room on the street side and he claimed he couldn't sleep at all because of the noise. Ours was very quiet so you might want to check your rooms location when you book. A great idea is the coffee/thee with muffins in the lobby every morning till 10.30am. As international travellers find a seat in the cozy lobby, it's easy to start conversation. For travellers not wanting to mingle, you can hide behind a large selection of newspapaers. The hotel also has a concierge helping out with transportation and theater tickets. Was very happy with this hotel and would definitely consider staying there again for a next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wolcott NYC”
Reviews.Author: Fez_Abas
Reviews.Content: My first trip to the States and NYC. Was looking for an accessible, affordable & comfortable place to stay for a couple of days before meeting a friend in Atlanta. Room was clean and had a walk in wardrobe! Appreciated the privacy given yet staff were helpful when requested for assistance. Impressed with the hotel that i came back for my second stay before my flight back to Singapore. Well done! ;>

Reviews.Title: “Dingy”
Reviews.Author: missgrl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Thanksgiving. Good location near Herald Square. We thought we would pick a more adventurous local hotel rather than a chain, and this came up on a travel website. Once I saw the room I wished I had rethought that decision! Spacious enough but VERY worn and dingy, to the point of icky. Very basic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: POD757
Reviews.Content: I have given this hotel full stars as I cannot fault it at all. This hotel is great value of money and the location for a first visit to New York was perfect, everything was in walking distance. Our room was spotless and was cleaned everyday. We were on the 2nd floor and felt very safe. The staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful although we did not spend a huge amount in the hotel itself. The muffins and tea/coffee in the morning were a perfect start to a busy day, the only issue would be that there is not ample seating for everyone depending on what time you go down for the muffins. I would definitely return to this hotel and would recommend it. The only negative was the air conditioning was a little noisy but after a busy day out in the city we were to tired to hear it!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel within easy walking distance of sights and station”
Reviews.Author: SandyIsleofWight
Reviews.Content: Large comfortable, quiet room with separate seating area which was handy for husband who is an early riser. Complementary coffee and muffins each morning (most hotels have no facilities for food and drink). Very helpful staff. An easy walk from Penn rail station (with wheeled cases) and we were checked in straight away at 11a.m. Walkable to Time square, central park, maceys, Empire state, Top of the Rock etc. Would definitely go back if visiting NY

Reviews.Title: “The warmly welcoming Wolcott”
Reviews.Author: Illia S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in September, 2011. Excellent location, professional stuff, clean and neat rooms - all this for very good for NY prices. There is no restaurant in the hotel, but you can always have hot coffee and fresh muffins for breakfast, what really helps to start your day with smth positive. We recommend this hotel for tourists from other countries for very good correspondence of the price to quality.

Reviews.Title: “The Amazing Wolcott Hotel”
Reviews.Author: William R
Reviews.Content: The Wolcott Hotel is one of those hotels that you will want to return to time and again. It may not have the greatest facilities, it may not have a restaurant (though it does have a splendid and historic ballroom undergoing a seemingly endless restoration), but it does have something that is priceless and that is Character and it has this in abundance. Add to this an efficient and helpful front desk, cheerful and courteous chamber maids, spacious rooms, the most convenient location in mid-town Manhatten and outstanding value for money, and you have a hotel that will become your mainstay for every visit to New York. Book early though, the word has gotten out - globally!

Reviews.Title: “so close and secure.”
Reviews.Author: brid D
Reviews.Content: i have stayed in this hotel 3 times now. what more would you need on a fun break in New York. Great location 5 min. from Macys, very secure, nice and warm and clean, great coffee and muffins to kickstart a long busy day in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value The hotel Wolcott”
Reviews.Author: bikerboy255068
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great Location in Manhattan and close to the Empire State Building. We arrived late one evening and asked for a quiet room and even though it did not have a view it was lovely and quiet and comfortable. We found the staff very helpful (cannot understand some of the negative reviews on here about staff) they were all very obliging and friendly during our stay. The rooms are a bit old but it is very good value for a hotel in this location. Rooms were clean and comfortable so we would recommend The Wolcott for position and value in New York

Reviews.Title: “wolcott hotel - best deal in town”
Reviews.Author: erezberez
Reviews.Content: baest location best value for money dicent service lousy breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Deal”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: The Wolcott is a charming old hotel ideally sited in central mid-town Manhattan within walking distance to the bus terminal at Penn Station, subways and Time Square. Rooms are clean, updated and comfortable, rates are very reasonable - if you don't need a lot of big-chain hotel amenities/services, it is an ideal hotel for the budget traveler to NYC, particularly foreign visitors. Has a beautiful old-style Main Lobby.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: ARGYROV
Reviews.Content: nice rooms, in the center of Manhatan, very close to the metro stations to every destination, very cleen, good price, recomended as the best place to stay in N.Y.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Brandy152
Reviews.Content: Was very happy with my break in NY. Very centrally located. Complimentary breakfast included Good value hotel. will be staying again

Reviews.Title: “Going to NYC?Choose Wolcott hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Zdebar
Reviews.Content: We have stayed to this hotel 4th times and the stay was alwayes marvellous. We are older couple and we very appriciated that the room is absolutly isolated from noise. Staff is very helpfull and nice. The hotel is very comfortable and clean. We found very nice the possibility of being able to do loundry and ironing anytime we want in the basement if the hotel. We also recommended the hotel to our friends who decided to stay in Wolcott and were also very sutisfied. The public transport in NYC is incredible and the nearist one is 4 min out of the hotel. If we come to NYC again we will stay at Wolcott again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel - Left Early and Will Never Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: kim e
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wolcott Hotel last year on business. We had booked rooms for two nights. After checking in I was very unhappy with the quality of the hotel. The rooms were incredibly old, dingy, hot and stuffy. I was afraid to sleep on the bed. The shower/tub in the bathroom must have been a foot and a half by three feet maximum, and the ceiling slanted over it. I'm only 5'10" and I had a terrible time trying to shower there. I tried to check out later that day after we found another hotel to take us without a reservation. They said we couldn't check out until the next day so I had to spend the night. The bed felt like sleeping on concrete. I backpacked Europe for six months and never stayed in a hotel/hostel this bad. We checked out first thing in the morning and went to our new hotel for our second night. Don't be fooled by the lobby and pictures online. I would never, ever return and wouldn't recommend to anyone else either.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel near the Empire State Building”
Reviews.Author: Edgar V
Reviews.Content: This historic hotel is a few blocks from the Empire State Building. It has allure, a friendly staff and nice rooms. Perfect for a short or a long stay in the 'city that never sleeps'. I visited the Wolcott Hotel in May 2010 and I definitely book this hotel again if I visit New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel to Stay for price & location!”
Reviews.Author: Greg R
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed at the Wolcott 3 times now and i'd stay there again if i went back to New York. Its spot on for both price and location, your on the doorstep of the empire state building, and just a short walk from Time Square. You have the hop on hop off tour busses going past all the time if you wanted a great way to get around and see everything. The hotel offers you the basics that you need so you dont need to splash the cash on hotel and have less money for the other things on your trip. They offer a clean and comfortable hotel in a good location for a good price. They have the conciege service in the hotel and also a little shop where you can pick up drinks, snacks, newspapers, small gifts, postcards and pens etc. I'd recommend it to anyone who goes.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Manhatten”
Reviews.Author: DOMINIQUE M
Reviews.Content: One of the best place to stay in NYC. nearby all the facilities you need , shops, transportation, thearters...... Rooms are confortable and clean, you certainely will come again an again

Reviews.Title: “Elena”
Reviews.Author: ElenaMdv
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location and great price for where it is and what you get. Highly recommended.This hotel is situated just a few doors away from 5th Avenue on 31st st excellent location in mid Manhattan. The staff was excellent, very helpful and friendly. Room was spacious and comfortable. There are no breakfast facilities but there is tea and coffee plus muffins in the lobby every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, clean, reasonably priced hotel near a ton of things to do and see in the City”
Reviews.Author: Ilovecows
Reviews.Content: I try to stay at this hotel when I am in NY but unfortunately rooms are booked. The hotel has old gorgeous architecture. It is convenient walking distance to just about everything in the city. Shopping, Empire State Bld., St Pats church, Grand Central Station, Madison Sq. Garden, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and much more!

Reviews.Title: “Wolcott”
Reviews.Author: onlyonebridge
Reviews.Content: We were going for 5 days to NYC and stayed at the Wolcott. We had clean, large rooms for 3. The hotel is well situated and close to all transportation. We had muffins and coffee for breakfast which gave us a good start on the city excursions. The staff was very helpful and courteous and I can highly recommend this hotel. Loved the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “A little Europe in NYC”
Reviews.Author: jay c
Reviews.Content: Great location .A couple of blocks from Penn Station . Rooms are neat and clean. Decor is nice. Staff are very helpful. Many guests are travelers from abroad. Coffee and muffin in the lobby in the morning... This is a niche hotel. It is over a 100 years old but it has been renovated .It is not enormous.. uptown bus a block away. walk a block in the other direction and take the subway at Greeley Square..We come back year after year and the front desk staff remember us... It's a nice feeling...

Reviews.Title: “Very good rooms in a very good location!”
Reviews.Author: HeloisaBPE
Reviews.Content: I know this hotel since 1997 and I love staying there!! The bedrooms are spacious, well decorated, very good location and the staff is already like family to me.

Reviews.Title: “Charm and Elegance in Midtown”
Reviews.Author: webwalker222
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on a previous visit to NYC when I stayed at another property and went for a walk around the neighbourhood. I saw this hotel and looked into it and decided to book it for my next trip. It was an excellent choice! We were a party of 3, and the hotel upgraded us to a room with 3 beds for no extra charge when we checked in! We didn't mind that there was scaffolding on the building (when isn't there, in NYC?) but we had a tiny view of the Empire State Building so we were happy. The room was comfortable enough, the 3rd bed was in a separate room which we were delighted by since our 3rd member snores. It was warm, but the A/C worked well. They have elevators, which are notoriously slow in Manhattan so this didn't bother us too much. Absolutely no problem with bedbugs, in fact it was supremely clean and quiet on our floor. Good water pressure in the shower. Loved it! The breakfast was minimal (muffins, coffee) but we were up early and didn't really need it. There are vending machines on a different level if you need it. They store bags for free (but you should tip them for the service!). The staff was great, no issues. They made our stay memorable. I cannot find fault with this hotel, and hope to stay there again. Reasonable rates I hope will never change!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, fabulous stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jules00009
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel, absolutely the best location for times square, where all the bars and nightlife and broadway plays are. Staff at the hotel were very courteous, informative and obliging. Our 3 bedded room was great, had everything we needed, and a good ensuite with bath and good shower facilities. Breakfast was very relaxing as we were able to go downstairs to the lobby and bring a tray of fresh muffins and coffee back up to the room. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and we will definately stay there again when we next visit New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Deirdree
Reviews.Content: The Wolcott is such a great location, steps fom 5th avenue. Rooms are very clean, comfortable and warm.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Grizz_10
Reviews.Content: Really like the Wolcott. Great location and excellent value for money. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the muffins are a nice touch in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: Robert P
Reviews.Content: We were recommended by a friend for staying at the Wolcott hotel during our visit in New York. And it is a very good recommendation. Concerning us it is a perfect location with a very good value to stay when you visit New York. Correct handling and and a very helpful and friendly staff. Room is cleaned every day; The hotel is just 5 minutes walking from the Empire State building, 15 minutes from Time Square. Nearby a underground station. Next visit to New York we will stay again in the Hotel. Robert

Reviews.Title: “New York during Police & Fire Games and Hurricane”
Reviews.Author: Lehout
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the hotel we were assigned a corner unit which in our estimation was quite spacious. We were to be at the hotel a total of 8 nights. The concierge on duty on the two Thursdays obviously was not enamoured of her job as she was rude and not the least bit helpful. Having said that all others during the stay were wonderful. The hotel was clean, centrally located and would recommend for a short stay. During the hurricane we asked about emergency preparedness and were told just stay in. Where there flashlights or back up generator questions were met with blank stares. There were hoards of people loitering in the lobby for 3 days during the city shut down and after exploring on our own found some local places that had remained opened for food etc. It might have been helpful if staff had posted locations to assist their guests. Housekeeping staff stayed during hurricane which was an added bonus....no disruption of service.

Reviews.Title: “An Answer to My Dream”
Reviews.Author: cai8
Reviews.Content: I was absolutely thrilled to find the Wolcott, a reasonably-priced downtown hotel. I used to live in New York and like to visit often, so I have long been looking for a comfortable, well-located, not-exorbitant hotel which I could use as a regular and reliable home base when I am visiting. I have found what I'm looking for. I love the lobby, the sizable rooms, and the international atmosphere. My only relatively minor complaint is that the rooms could be better lit. Yes, the plumbing is a bit ornery, but that's not unusual in NYC. I will definitely stay at the Wolcott in the future.

Reviews.Title: “I return here every other year!!”
Reviews.Author: Angela T
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to New York many times and tried various hotels, none as friendly or welcoming as this, walk in to wonderful high guilt ceilings, in easy access to all sites of interest, broadway, fifth avenue and the empire state. Very comfortable rooms, slept very well and best of all no noise to bother us sleeping!! Coffee and muffin in a morning was just perfect, no time constraints for getting up and the most helpful reception without the bell boy cenario to keep paying for, much more my british way of being, if I've shopped and carried my goods all day why pay for someone else to carry it for 5 minutes? Clean, comfortable and welcoming, easy access to Penn station to get around and from the airport. Just perfect, will be there again in 3 weeks time.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous! Great price for the city.”
Reviews.Author: AliceSherry
Reviews.Content: The beautiful architectual features made this hotel feel luxurious and nostalgic. The room was spacious enough to accommodate a family of four. The best featute-the blackout curtains made for a peaceful nights sleep. I brag all the time about finding this fabulous hotel for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “NYC”
Reviews.Author: caemptynesters
Reviews.Content: A clean room in NYC at a reasonable price. The room is small but very quite. The only time we spent in room was to sleep. It met all are needs for our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “my stay at the wolcott”
Reviews.Author: sharon h
Reviews.Content: My friend and I have made several trips to NYC and stayed at the Wolcott. We find the room clean and quiet. The location is great, just a few blocks from Macys. The staff is always helpful. We hope to stay there again in the near future and many times after.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home in New York”
Reviews.Author: hazza60
Reviews.Content: I found this Hotel on the internet, whilst searching all engines on the internet. We are residents of Australia. I found the Hotel Staff to be helpful and Courteous. The rooms were very clean and pleasantly large. The location is very central to all attractions you need to see in NY. I did read the reviews on this Hotel and after our stay cannot agree with the few negative comments posted. I guess they were having a bad day. This Hotel is indeed a little oasis in a very busy city. Thank you for making our stay to your city even more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay in NYC for Budget Price”
Reviews.Author: HanR82
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April 2010 (although the date of travel listed would only let me select Dec 2010 as the latest date) for 7 nights, loved the hotel for its prices. Reception were very friendly and staff very helpful, especially when our friend got stuck in NYC due to the ash cloud, they allowed another cot bed in our room for a very low price so that she was with accomodation. The rooms are a little dated but clean and cosy. Great location - right next to Macy's and subway station and the Empire State Building just around the corner. Breakfast is muffins and coffee/tea which was a lovely little touch. I would certainly stay here again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wolcott Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ps S
Reviews.Content: Good value in a good location. Morning coffee and muffins a nice plus. Tv's could use some updating in rooms but overall a good budget hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Judy S
Reviews.Content: I found this boutique hotel a delight - the art deco lobby - the friendly, helpful staff - continental breakfast - business center plus a recently remodeled room conveniently located a few blocks south of 34th street between 5th & 6th Ave. The price was just right for my budget. I have recommended this to my friends and will definitely stay there again (providing they have rooms available).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: jacksonnick2002
Reviews.Content: 200 dollars for 4 nights, between 2, on 5th avenue,10 mins from time square!!!!! If you want cheap and cheerful, no frills but in a fantastic location...ideal......if you intend to spend anytime actually in the hotel other then sleeping or washing, go elsewhere!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, price and confort”
Reviews.Author: Pedro M
Reviews.Content: The title pretty much sums everything up, we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “The best and central hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: FernandoMM
Reviews.Content: Wolcott Hotel its a surprising hotel, very central and near Empire state building ( fantastic view at night from the window of the room, all iluminated ), and a walk distance of the great interesting points in NYC. Nobody goes to NYC to sleep, so the accomodations are great. And a final consideration - Muffins and cofee at lobie. Absolutly glamorous

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with two small niggles.”
Reviews.Author: rab-the-rant
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 nights in wolcott, very good location, room was small but nice. Shower hard to keep at good temperature, and some banging from central heating, other than that very good overall

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fine for couple of days”
Reviews.Author: LeBaronRouge
Reviews.Content: I only found out that we were staying here after I had booked a package trip to Niagra Falls , New York and the QM2. When I read the reviews, I was dreading our stay, but I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised. The lobby has been mentioned numerous times in reviews and is very impressive. We found the staff perfectly OK and helpful, if not given to an excess of smiling.In contrast to a number of recent reviews, our room was very small and if we had been staying more than a couple of days, that could have become a problem. However, it was well furnished; air conditioned; had a good TV; wardrobe and bathroom and was perfectly clean. The one thing we skipped was the advertised muffins and coffee for breakfast, given the mixed reports I read and the fact that when we appeared in the lobby on our first morning, you could hardly move for about 150 people all standing around and sitting on any available surface, chomping away on muffins! Not a pretty sight! We stuck to our p-lan to go and find Cafe 28 some three minutes away on the corner of 28th Street and Fifth Ave. which was superb for breakfast. But that's another story. In summary, we were expecting the worst at the Wolcott and we were pleasantly surprised to find it a very acceptable tourist hotel, in a superb location, which was fine - albeit for a short stay in our particular room.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, huge rooms, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Nessa126
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely, classic hotel. The lobby is beautiful and makes a great first impression. The staff were friendly and offered advice and information when asked. The rooms a huge and although a little dated in terms of mod cons it was just what we needed. The best thing about the hotel is definitely it's location. You can see the Empire State from the doorstep and it's just 2 blocks up 5th Avenue. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt knock the place!!”
Reviews.Author: the_Dodges
Reviews.Content: Before i went to NYC in October this year, I was reading all the reviews on this page and i was dreading going in the end!! When i got there and checked in i was SOOO happy and relieved.... A lot of people did make this place sound like a Hotel from hell... Yet it wasnt the Ritz but you are not paying the Ritz prices, it was simple, CLEAN, FANTASTIC location, we were on the 12th floor, no view, but who cares? A view would of been nice but i was in New York!! i was seeing them amazing views all day long... Most of the staff were great, apart from 2 older men, if they smiled i think their faces would crack, but you cant win em all. I would stay there again, already planning my next trip and will be staying there, Most places were within walking distance, Loved the place, cant wait to go back, and to all those who are thinking of going..... You dont live in the hotel, its only there to shower and sleep, Fantastic choice, Fantastic location, this hotel is RECOMENDED!! Travelled on 6th October 2011 with Husband and 14 yr old son :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the price”
Reviews.Author: MI-MYRA74
Reviews.Content: Three and a half stars would be more like it. I found this hotel on line because I was looking for a hotel that had 3 beds for my sisters and I. The location is great and the price was reasonable for NYC. After doing research I booked the hotel but then I got concerned because there were negative comments here and other internet sites. Anyway we took the plunge and we are glad we did! The room was spacious, the bathroom small, but adequate and clean. The room was clean (except the carpet, it needs to be replaced), the beds were comfy, sheets were crisp and clean. The lobby is beautiful and the staff was pretty good. They offered morning coffee and muffins but and we didn't really bother because we wanted to go out to the city for breakfast.Overall we were very satisfied and with our experience. This is the 2nd time I stayed in a hotel in Midtown and it was great and we felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “great location and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Ricardo B
Reviews.Content: Stayed at your hotel in september for my birthday and i have to say i enjoyed every minute of it. I have to also say "thank you" for your night staff (cathleen and eric). Without there help i wouldve been lost.They were very polite and patient with me. It made my trip to New York even better. I have to say when i am in the new york area again i will be coming back to your hotel just because of your friendly staff, your rooms and the location it is in.

Reviews.Title: “Wolcott Hotel - would recommend”
Reviews.Author: sx2stephy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from five nights in hotel, would thoroughly recommend. Massive room, clean hotel, nice little extras ipod dock, playstation controllers, hairdryer. Fifth time in NY and the best value it has to be said. Great location for everything, staff friendly and muffins also good. Worth a stay for clean, safe, and central (affordable) place in New York!!

Reviews.Title: “Staff Appauling, rooms disgusting Please do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: AmandaJP_11
Reviews.Content: I had been traveling around the States with 2 other girls and had got used to staying in poor rooms but this was something else. On the first day we got there we dumped our suitcases in our room and headed down to reception. I asked the guy behind the counter where was best to eat and go. He dumped a map in front of me and said "Go out there and ask people" I said ok could you tell us wheres good to eat he snapped and shrugged his shoulder "What do you want to eat?, your in New York you can eat everywhere!". I was so appauled at his behavour we just left and continued with our day. When we got back the smell in the elevator was foul, there was no venterlation anywhere, the air conditioning unit was so loud it drowned the noise from outside and barely of us got any sleep. The icing on the cake came when we went to leave we were meant to have a 5am pick up but it never came, we asked the guy at reception to call us a cab but he told us to wait 15mins. After 15mins he reluctantly called on our behalf but couldnt get through to anyone, we asked him to call us a cab and he snapped at us saying "your not even paying me" like he wanted us to tip him for doing his job! I think said to my friend i was going to hail a cab at which point he slammed down the phone to the cab company and said that if i was going to hail a cab then what was the point of him calling to get us one (which he said would come in 30mins time) not what you need when your flying back to the UK. Overall just an appauling place, please do not stay here! I wish i had read a few more reviews before this was booked up as I would have definatly NOT STAYED HERE! It completly ruined our experience of NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pixbon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in February, when i seen the hotel I loved it, the foyer was elegant and lovely looking. However once we steeped out the lift there was a horrible smell, the bedroom was tiny with the beds up against the walls with barely any room to move. The view was of the bins in the yard and the ladders made it look so easy to get into our room throught the window. There were no facilities other than a very expensive shop. Would have really appreciated a restraunt or a swimming pool. However, the location of the hotel was excellent, the empire state building was on the next street. Perfect midtown location. But the hotel was terrible and I couldn't put up with it again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Poor room”
Reviews.Author: pixie3
Reviews.Content: very small room with bed up against wall, making it difficult for 2nd person to get in and out!! Extremely hot in corridor as well as room which had extremely noisy airconditioning. Staff not very welcoming. No bar for drinks in the evening, no restaurant or any other facilities. On the plus side, free safe in the room and location was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Staff makes the expierence horrible!!”
Reviews.Author: Lovestobooktravel
Reviews.Content: As a travel agent, I have found this hotel very difficult to use. The staff has been very rude and uncooperative. I had my clients booked into this hotel and upon speaking to management (both the general manager and the sales manager) at the hotel we have decided to cancel the reservation as I will not subject them to this type of treatment. I will not be recommending this hotel to ANY clients in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mickjj
Reviews.Content: As always when arriving at a hotel for the first time you hope you have made the right choice, as we pulled up outside and saw the building shrouded by scaffolding we thought the worst. We could not have been more wrong from the majestic lobby to the huge room with high ornate ceiling we were over the moon with our choice. The full size bathroom had the most powerful shower I have ever encountered it was like getting a massage. The beds were comfortable and the room very clean. The location was super, only a couple of blocks from the Empire State Building and Macey's with many resteraunts, bars and cafes close by. I would recommend this hotel to anybody and we will certainly return there. But to top it all off was the price, easily the best value for money in New York!.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location... Rude staff”
Reviews.Author: xXpollyTXx
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed at the Wolcott hotel on 2nd Sept- 5th Sept. Fantastic location right down the road from empire state building. I loved our room also, nice and big, comfy beds right down the hall so it was very quiet..The shower wasnt very good but oh well. Staff Were a bit rude.. didnt really say hello when we came in, kind of spoke to us like we were stupid and when we asked about things in new york like different attractions and how to get to them etc none of the staff really knew and one even gave us wrong directions.. you'd think that working in Manhatten you'd have good knowledge of Manhatten especially if your in the tourist industry.. All in all if your not really in the hotel much and are just looking for somewhere to sleep in a great location this is a really good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The only good thing is the location”
Reviews.Author: Guiomarananda Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel its being renewed, the service is rude and the breakfast it terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, rude reception staff”
Reviews.Author: ClareOD_Cork
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in May, the hotel is right around the corner from the Empire State building, so location was great. The room was grand - good size for NYC, basic enough but fine. My complaint about this hotel was that the reception staff were rude, they never greeted us or even acknowledged us when we came or went from the hotel, didn't reply if we said hi, we asked for directions one day and were totally dismissed and told to check with tourist infomation...they were really unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “We could see the Empire State Building from our window”
Reviews.Author: Pavelnash
Reviews.Content: A grand old building, even if faded and a little shabby now, it has personality and atmosphere. Rooms are a bit small and the decor, though tidy, is a little overpowering. But the baths are large with decent showers over, and there are free muffins and coffee in the foyer each morning! The biggest plusses are the price - very cheap for midtown Manhattan - and the location right by the Empire State Building and a short walk from Macy's and Penn Street Station, the Flatiron Building and Madison Square Garden. A good budget option if you want to be right in the thick of things but not pay a king's ransom.

Reviews.Title: “New York accommodation at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: chrissavige
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and booked a junior suite. We felt the extra room would be handy and it was. The room was comfortable and the bathroom clean and modern. New Yord prices can be over the top but this hotel is not. A guest laundry is on site which we used and also used the storage facilities as we had a late flight. The hotel is located just two blocks from Macey's and the subway is nearby. Plenty of places to eat and a couple of parks nearby to relax in. The lovely reception area and breakfast was that basic New York hotel muffin and coffee. The staff were helpful without being over friendly but given the number of people that go through the place that can be expected. The concierge each day was also very helpful and assisted with booking tours and there is also a convenience store on site as well.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel will make you cry”
Reviews.Author: melissa2883
Reviews.Content: Booked 3 nights and stayed for 30 minutes. The hallways smelled like homeless people and the room smelled like an ashtray. The guy at the front desk was obviously high, everything about this place sucked. Don't even consider staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Brillaiant”
Reviews.Author: biff_11
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in NYC and loved it! The hotel is in a brilliant location, not far from the Empire State Building. Everything is in easy access. The hotel was clean & the staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convienant. Fit the bill for our trip”
Reviews.Author: MaggieMaySc
Reviews.Content: I had been in the lobby before, but never stayed there. I was concerned by previous reviewers. I was pleasantly surprised. My expectations were low and it far exceeded them! It is a budget hotel, but it was clean and comfortable. It is great for the type of hotel it is. We were just doing an overnight between trains and it was just a couple of blocks away. The rooms were large by any standard and HUGE by NYC standards. The bathroom was very large as well. Beds a little firm for my taste, but the sheets were nice and clean. Towels clean and absorbent.. Checked for bedbugs...negative We were upgraded to a junior suite upon check in. Unlike other posts the staff was very nice to me and my party. Plenty of muffins and coffee in the lobby for breakfast.. Plenty of places to eat nearby. Had ice cream at Harold's Square. Ran from the hotel to Central Park the next morning. I felt perfectly safe. I would stay there again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Awful! Do not stay here.”
Reviews.Author: ncarring Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: This was supposed to have been a romantic weekend in NY, but thanks to this hotel the weekend soon lost it's sparkle. About the only positive for this hotel is that it is located within a convenient walk of the Empire State and other mid-town attractions. The side-street that the hotel is located on is dirty and not at all attractive and the façade of the hotel is very unimpressive. Not what one might expect from a property advertised to have period appeal. That said, the hotel owners have obviously put a significant effort into maintaining the period look of the lobby area, which was very ornately decorated and attractive. A character that has unfortunately not been continued through to their reception desk, which looks more like something from a budget two star establishment. As for the rooms, those that we experienced were small and poorly maintained, with tired décor and furnishings. In fact, our room had an air-conditioner that sounded as if it was going to rattle out of the window frame, which easily drowned out the surrounding street noise below and was impossible to sleep through. There were also visible stains on the carpet and ceiling. The bathroom shelving was thoroughly rusty and covered in layers of dust and had to be replaced during our stay. The ceiling of the bathroom was also covered in dilapidated panels, which were in need of some attention. (SEE PICTURES) Also, be warned, everything at this hotel comes at an extra cost. It'll cost you $1 to make a 1800 free-phone call from your room, which is higher than the 60 cents/min they charge for local calls. No free wireless connection and what is on offer is very highly priced and not of an executive standard. Luggage storage consists of coin operated lockers that are not big enough for large suitcases, although the front desk will begrudgingly store these in their back room if you ask. There are also none of the standard coffee and tea making facilities one might expect from a hotel of this class, not even on request. We were simply told that coffee and tea would be made available in the lobby at breakfast time, which consists of nothing more than a few stale muffins. This hotel may have been a proud example of a three star hotel in it's time, but unfortunately those days have long since passed and the current management seem more interested in profiteering than maintaining service standards. We absolutely regret staying here and would most certainly not recommend that future travellers look elsewhere. If you're looking for budget, the Holiday Inn provide a far better standard, at a vastly cheaper rate. If you're looking for charming décor and a period feel then you better camp in the hotels lobby, as this is the only visible evidence of any historical note.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice traditional hotel”
Reviews.Author: Finbarjc421
Reviews.Content: Great location and nice hotel. Classy lobby area and rooms of a good standard. Beds very comfy and bathroom spacious - great power showers! Breakfast was just muffins every day which was a bit of a disappointment, as was the cockroach that ran under the toilet when I first entered but I only ever saw one and I'm told they are a widespread problem in NY. Overall good value for money - a well furnished, clean, trafditional hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Thorey_11
Reviews.Content: When we came to the hotel we just got our room and it was absolutely great. Friendly service and excellent staff. The room was very clean and the beds were so comfortable. The room was quiet and had a great air condition. The location could not have been better. Just few steps from everything like the main shopping street where you could find all of the best shops. H&M, Macy´s, gap, Desigual, Foot Locker, Victoria´s secret an so on... We just loved the hotel. We slept well because how quiet it was and comfy. We used the Subway a lot and would recommend people to do so. It was so easy and without a doubt the best way to get around. We also loved that there was Subway and Dunkin Donuts just across the street from the hotel. We just had an excellent stay and would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, rude staff member let them down.”
Reviews.Author: Allikat_Oz
Reviews.Content: A great little find. Perfect location. Close enough to all the tourist spots without being in the middle of all the hustle and bustle. Rooms clean, yet basic. All you really need when you spend little time in them. Free muffins/coffee a great inclusion if you want to save on a light breakfast. Only negative aspect was the staff member (Kabine - I believe) at checkout. At 2:30am we attempted to checkout which took over 20 min and was still not finalised by the time we left, in spite of not accruing any extra charges. He was not ready for us and did not offer an apology. Instead he was condescendingly telling me to "relax" after I advised him the shuttle bus, which had arrived, would not wait any longer. He was rude and implied I was an inconvenience even though I advised the day before of the expected early check out. Apart from our experience with Kabine, the hotel was good in every other way.

Reviews.Title: “An Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fridolina
Reviews.Content: I had the job to find myself and some family members a cheap but still decent hotel i New York City. For Easter. As you can imagine, that wasn't easy. Thanks to reviews here on TripAdvisor I finally went for it and booked Wolcott, telling my family they shouldn't expect the hotel to be very good. What struck os first was the elegant lobby and the convienient location (we arrived by train to PennStation, a 10 min walk away). We were also surprised to hear that a small coffee+muffin-breakfast was included in the price! The hotel had booked us on the ninth floor in two rooms next to each other, which was perfect. The rooms were very basic but ok. To me the bathroom and the bed are the most important in a hotel room, and here the bed was good and the bathroom OK. The carpet on the floor was stained and old. Don't hesitate to choose the Wolcott if basic is good enough for you. The location is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!!”
Reviews.Author: JMacL0nd0n
Reviews.Content: This hotel has bed bugs! I tried to bring it to the attention of management in a discreet way but they didn't come to my room when requested. Instead of waiting and missing my train to DC I mentioned it at check out. The staff replied by implying I had lied saying that no one had called reception asking for a manager. The man on front desk then suggested I called him back later that morning. Can you imagine? Why should I go out of my way and pay to call him on my UK mobile? The hotel and the staff are disgraceful!

Reviews.Title: “NYC on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: TSWilliams
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Wolcott in October 2010 for a long weekend. There were 5 of us in total across 2 rooms. The triple room we had was very roomy, the beds large and comfy and although the decor was very dated it was clean and tidy and had all the amenities we needed. No restaurant or bar in this hotel but they do provide muffins and tea or coffee for guests each morning. The muffins were delicious and fresh and several flavours were available. It would have been nice if some water or fruit juice would have been available for drinks though. The hotel is not on the main road which was better as this made it a little quieter if your not used to the noise of the city. The view from our window was very limited (the building next door) but to be honest we didnt spend a massive amount of time in there (why would you - its New York) anyway. Come out of the front of the buiding though and look up, the Empire State Building is right there and about a 2 min walk away. Location wise the hotel is ideal. It takes no time at all the walk to Times Square, Central Park or any of the other amazing attractions available. There are plenty of restaurants around the area to find decent food, but then you are so close to the centre that it doesnt make much difference anyway. I do intend to return to NYC as my husband missed out on this trip, and hope to stay here again. The location is fantastic and the price is so much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money!!”
Reviews.Author: LaoisLad
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 10 Nights from 15th to 25 march 2011 with my Girlfriend..Were 28 and 24.Booked it because it was so cheap and the location was excellent,31st st between 5th and 6th. Rooms were big with a very comfy bed..hard to leave it in the mornings!! Fare enough it doesnt have a restaurent or some of the extras but if you want that just book an expencive hotle! The staff were friendly and helpfull and the location was so good we walked to everytin..Empire state was 2 mins away..Madison square garden and penn station 5 mins walk and times square 10 mins..what more do you need! Def get in an Nba Game if you can..And if your a 'Friends' fan..Sorry Joey but the Knicks dont rule...!!!!!!!!! We drank and ate a good bit in O'reillys bar on 35th street also between 5th and 6th but the best place we found for food was Jimmys american Grill http://www.facebook.com/pages/Jimmys-American-Grill-Bar/111260395611936.....yummie!!!!!!! Would def recommend the $79 City Pass and the the all link red bus tours...And if you want a broadway show Chicago was class...Especially if your a guy lol.. All in all for $1200 for 10 nights it was a bargain..def stay here again so book it guys! Tom & Lor Laois/Tipperary ,Rep. of Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, well located hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Tel3005
Reviews.Content: Following some of the reviews, we were a little apprehensive, but the Wolcott was excellent value. The staff weren't chatty, but were professional, the rooms clean and spacious (for New York!) and the showers worked! Great location, nice muffins and coffee, good value for a lively trip to New York.

Reviews.Title: “stay away!”
Reviews.Author: shoptiludrop1
Reviews.Content: Hotel is not as shown on website pictures, rooms are dirty, aircon sometimes doesnt work. I asked my luggage to be left in their secure area after check out. Upon collecting it, I noticed the padlocks were tampered with. I reported this to the receptionist, he was rude & did not listen saying it doesnt happen to their hotel, yeah right! I showed him my tampered suitcase, but he became even worst!. The lady at the tour desk is often not there & doesnt seem to know New York! Hotel lobby & every floor lobby smells as there is no centralised aircon. Breakfast is free but staff need to check for hygiene as folks use their hands to pick the muffins. Wifi is slow and not free. Bathroom not clean. Stay away as it'll ruin your NY experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location - good value”
Reviews.Author: LeoMoo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from 4 March - 10 March 2011. The location of this hotel is really what you are paying for. Our room was basic but clean. Not fancy, but realistically we just slept there at night. Some of the reviews we read complained that the room was too small. But we found that it was fine - especially because we kept all our suitcases in the large wardrobe so it helped keep the room feeling more spacious. The bedding was very comfortable. Our only complaint about the room was the shower. It could be a little temperamental and it took a while for the hot water to start. Sometimes the water temperature would suddenly become very hot or very cold. The tap handles were a little stiff, but we found that if we really turned them hard, we could adjust the temperature back to a good level. The only downside about this hotel was the front desk staff. They were not friendly at all and were actually quiet rude - except for the young guy who worked the late night shifts. He was very friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is very ornate inside and really feels like a turn of the century building. Just lovely. Also there were free muffins and coffee in the morning which was great. The hotel has a coin operated laundry which is very helpful. Whilst it doesn't have a restaurant, it is directly across the road from Ayza wine and chocolate bar. It's a great little place, very popular. We recommend the white truffle pizza! Yum!! All in all, we would stay here again. Its a great price, for a fantastic location. Aside from the largely rude staff, its really a nice little place - as long as you aren't expecting the Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT CENTRAL NEW YORK HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: stevie56_10
Reviews.Content: For a new york hotel on a reasonable(for New York) budget it is a great hotel, friendly & helpful reception, smallish rooms but adequate. very good maid service, clean towels every day. Didnt take advantage of the coffee and muffins provided in a morning as it was a bit too busy for me. very centrally situated on west 31st a couple of blocks from subways, also a couple of blocks from penn station. You can also book your return to jfk or newark from here $22 dollars each to jfk. Overall highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly hotel well situated”
Reviews.Author: JulieJ48
Reviews.Content: A charming quiet hotel with friendly chatty staff. Not on a main street but easy to find and close to subways. Lovely decor and feels classy whilst not expensive. Loved the muffins for breakfast. Not great on facilities (no bar, restaurant etc) but not needed plenty close by.

Reviews.Title: “the right place and price!”
Reviews.Author: justsaygo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights the weekend before Thanksgiving. 3 of us shared a 2 room suite (single bed in 1 room + queen bed in 2nd room ) with a single bath. It's not the Ritz!, but our room and bath were clean/ the towels were soft and fluffy and the breakfast of muffins/coffee/tea was decent. It's in a great location near Empire State and Macys, and the price of the 2 room suite can't be beat. Our only problem was heat ... we were on 10th floor and had too much heat in our suite, so we turned on A/C in order to sleep comfortably. Check-in and out was quick and easy ... no problems with parking and /or validating the parking ticket. I'm giving it 3 star rating because it fits my description of "shabby/sheik" ... good value older hotel with character.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent NYC hotel on a budget”
Reviews.Author: skygirl340
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers excellent value if you are looking for a good deal for a basic but clean hotel. We considered spending a lot more for a more upmarket hotel but decided for a city break it just wasn't worth it - we were hardly in the hotel room. This hotel is in an excellent location which made the rate even better value. The room was clean and spacious and very quiet. We did not experience any problems with the water in the shower as some other people had mentioned. The radiator does make a really strange spraying noise though! I had read that before we came and wondered how bad it would be. It turned out though that we were absolutely shattered every night and so just fell straight asleep so it didn't really cause a problem for us. The coffee and muffins in the lobby were an appreciated extra. Great to start the day and then you can look for somewhere to grab something else to eat if it's not enough to get you going. In the room there is a safe. Hairdryer also in bathroom. Great closet! If you check in before your room is ready or have bags to leave after check out there is a locker room where you can put your cases. The lockers are huge so fit our big cases in them. But if you need to use a few, no probelm they are only about a quarter or something like that per locker. We would stay in this hotel if we go back to NY. The money you save staying here goes a long way to enjoying other things the city has to offer. After all why spend all your money on the best hotel when you then have nothing left over to enjoy your holiday?!

Reviews.Title: “Invest in plumbing”
Reviews.Author: claricias
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on price. I'm not a fussy traveller - a clean bed and bathroom usually does the job - however I have never encountered a shower like this! There seemed to be no way to control the temperature - even when the hot tap is turned off the cold tap still spouts practically boiling water. Turning the hot tap on and off a few times seemed to do the trick - eventually. Location is fantastic, our 11th floor room also had a great view of the Empire State Building, and it is a few minutes walk to the subway and Macys. The hotel itself is old but kept very clean, I have stayed in far more modern hotels that have been grubby in comparison. While it is a nice added extra to get coffee and muffins in the morning for breakfast the lobby is ill equipped to cater for everyone at the same time, (more tables are needed)and as the previous comment noted there was a school group staying in the hotel last week and by coincidence our arrival in the lobby each morning usually coincided with their partaking breakfast, taking up every available seat and sittling on the floor. TIP - there's a small tray in your room under the ice bucket, just bring the coffee and muffins back up to the hotel room. I found the staff to be fairly helpful,desk staff were polite and pleasant on arrival and departure, the concierge helped us with directions to a particular area in Queens that we had to visit, but I think if you are used to 4 or 5 star hotels with staff brown nosing, then this is not the hotel for you. If you just want a very cheap, clean hotel that is in a fantastic location then this is the place to stay - and who goes to NYC to stay in their hotel room?

Reviews.Title: “Fine place to stay if you weren't going to be there much.”
Reviews.Author: RachaelM40
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Wolcott as part of our honeymoon last Aug. We expected it to be in need of refurberation, and had heard it was a little past it's sell-by date, but was clean and would do as a place to rest our heads while on a whirlwind visit of NY. The room they tried to put us in first was a complete disaster. It was tiny, barely room to step around the bed - which was hardly bigger than a single - I know we were on honeymoon, but come on! The ensuite was not an ensuite, it was a wet room, hardly big enough to turn around in, and you had to step though a closet to get to it. I was unimpressed to say the least. We'd speacified a large King-sized room and had been charged accordingly. My Husband went down to see what he could do, because if I'd gone, little miss smirky at the front desk would have had her day escalated from Bad to "Worst of her life!" in seconds. He came back with two room keys, the first he told me not to bother with, he knows me so well. The other room was larger, had a view of the Empire State, a real double bed, a proper wardrobe, safe, dressing table and we could walk past each other without fear of falling over. We took it. Amazing considering lettle miss "lucky escape" said ours was her only room left when we checked in, but had two to show us when ours was rejected. Obviously you don't come to NY to stay in your hotel, and we were no exception to that rule, but even it's basic and olde-worlde charm was lost on me after a day. Few amenities and basic coffee and soggy muffins in the lobby for breakfast. I wasn't impressed. The bed felt slept in, and the sheets were knobbly, I wasn't comfortable and was happy to move on. Before I forget, if your not comfortable with small spaces, avoid the lifts. Tiny, and oh, so slow. I swear I thought there was someone behind the scenes pulling ropes! Different people experience things differently, so if you want somewhere basic and clean and relatively inexpensive, go for it, but I personally wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, crap staff.”
Reviews.Author: dorisdelay
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel. I wasn't excepting anything special, and special it ain't. The rooms had the basics though (our room was quite spacey!) and they were sufficiently cleaned with fresh towels (and sheets if you wished) each morning - In fact, I'd go as far as to say that the cleaners were the most helpful of all the hotel staff. I echo everyone else's thoughts when I say the hotel staff were absolutely appalling - no help here whatsoever, not even a smile! The icing on the cake would've had to have been when I asked the concierge a question about transport to JFK airport and she responded with "I dunno" and that was that. Staff aside, our room had a lovely view of the Empire State Building and we found everything to be in reasonable walking distance. It was slightly annoying to have a couple of school groups staying at the same time (in the room next to ours, mind you); screeching all morning, knocking at our door and pressing every button on the elevator on the way down. Took all of my patience to not murder one of the miserable brats, but what can you do? I'd visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in NYC - Loved It”
Reviews.Author: mcco_99
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel in NYC. Reasonably prices and in a great location. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Would definatley recommend. This was our first time in NYC and we felt completely safe in this neighbourhood Thankyou for a wounderful stay

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend it”
Reviews.Author: Kasuta
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days at the Wolcott Hotel (end January, beginning February 2011). This is our second stay here, and we returned because we liked it the first time, about 3 years ago.
