Excellent location, close to buses, subway, Macy's, walking distance to midtown. The price was amazing (inexpensive) for New York. We had a junior suite, which allowed us for suitable space. Although this is not a "bells and whistles" hotel, we had everything we needed, a good bed, very clean linen (changed during our stay), good and ample towels, TV (2 for the suite), phones (2 for the suite), an excellent hair dryer, much better then the wall mounted fancy ones. Our room was impeccably clean - thank you Ana - and we also found the staff at the reception very friendly and helpful - thank you Cathy! There was plenty of information including a friendly lady at the information desk, also coffee and muffins in the morning in the gloriously decorated lobby. We found it somehow too warm in the room, maybe because we are used to sleep in a cool temperature. We had a comfortable stay and will definitely return next time we are in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good room and mixed service.”
Reviews.Author: Darkelve7
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived at the hotel, the receptionist wasn't friendly, but he did his job. Then we literally had to fight our way to the room. We had to pass through foul-smelling corridors, 2 doors and an extremely narrow staircase with 2 big suitcases! When we finally arrived at the room and opened the door it just bumped into one of the two beds. The room itself was really small (we didn't even have enough room for our bags) and smelled strange because it was a smoking room (wich we finally found out whenn we saw the ashtray). As we both are strict non-smokers, we had to go back to the reception (again the fight) and ask for another room. The receptionist gave us another room but blamed us for the "mistake" by telling us, that we have been there too early. I don't think he ever had the idea that he could ask us what we prefer - smoking room or wait for a non-smoking room. If he'd done that, we would have waited and he wouldn't have to give us another room. Despite the bad start, the second room was great! We got a huge room with 3 beds, 2 TVs and a little entrance area! The only annoying things were the noisy radiator and the air conditioner, which woke us up one day. That day it was raining and the rain hit the outside metal of the air conditioner, creating a very loud and steady clunk. Although the service at the reception wasn't very good, the service at the desk for the shows etc. was very helpful and friendly. The best thing about this hotel really is the location. It's within walking distance to Times Square, Empire State Building and Penn Station.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location just off 5th ave. Value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Deirdree
Reviews.Content: The location is great, just off 5th ave. Price includes coffee and muffins in the lobby in the morning...coffee is not good....muffins great. Clean, warm and good sized rooms.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: shelandi
Reviews.Content: Thankfully this gem has remained bed bug free! This hotel caters to European travelers and tourist. I am usually the only American business traveler there. Free coffee and muffins in the morning is a nice touch too. Great neighborhood, within walking distance to Times Square, Empire State Building and Penn Station. I look forward to staying here each time I go to NYC, which is at least twice a year.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room very loud and very hot”
Reviews.Author: SarahandSimon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at room 1013 which is a junior suite. This consisted of a separate area through an archway where my 2 year old was able to sleep in a travel cot. This area had a pull out bed, tv and a couple of chairs. Our first impression upon arriving on Christmas day was that the entrance was rather grand. The staff were polite but not friendly. They advised us there were free muffins and tea/coffee etc every morning in the lobby from 6am (which were delicious). Our room was ridiculously hot. I've noticed a couple of other reviews on here also say the same. We did complain about it but the heating wasn't on. This was during the snowstorm as well so it was freezing outside. The floors and the walls felt very hot so it must be from the pipes. Throughout our entire stay our windows were open constantly and only then was it just bearable. The decor was extremely old fashioned but I think this is probably part of the charm of the hotel which is over 100 years old. The bed was comfy and big. The bathroom wasn't too impressive as it didn't look very clean (the sort where you want to keep something on your feet so your skin doesn't touch the floor!). We got little sample bottles of shampoo and free soaps. Having said that it it could just be where the bathroom was so old - I didn't want to look too closely! Overall the hotel was okay and I'd probably stay there again. It wasn't particularly cheap though. The conscierge girl was the most miserable person I've come across in New York. She couldn't even crack a smile and her behaviour was bordering on rude. I watched her for a while whilst sitting in the lobby and she was more interested in texting someone than dealing with people and would make them wait whilst she finished her texting etc! Don't go here if you're looking for friendly staff and a fashionable trendy room with all the mod cons. (there are ipod docking stations in the rooms although my friend didn't have one in her room!). Go here if you're looking for a great location (just round the corner from Macy's and Empire State) and somewhere to rest your head.

Reviews.Title: “19th century charm with 21st century conveniencesentury”
Reviews.Author: BernMarcowitz079
Reviews.Content: This century old hotel has such charm, low prices, and central location that it may be unique. Even those not staying there should visit the French Palace lobby, and look at the memorobilia adorning its walls.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel of entire trip”
Reviews.Author: Sarah_A87
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? Reception was not at all welcoming or friendly. Like many have said previously, just did the bare minimum to check us in and get us out the way. Booked a triple share room and immediately the musty scent and dark, dreary vibe of the room hits you. Bathroom was shocking- shower had two settings- scalding hot and ice cold. Toilet didn't flush properly (tank wouldn't stop filling up). When we complained about this, our complaints were rarely attended to and as a result of this we came back to the hotel one afternoon to find the toilet had overflowed and flooded the bathroom and one of the bedrooms (resulting in my friends' suitcase being soaked and damaged by toilet water). When called to clean it up the cleaner did so- with bathroom towels! I went to reception to complain and ask for a different room- they seemed very upset by this and reluctantly gave us another room- next to a room which was apparently undergoing renovation/ demolition of some sort. I'd paid a lot of money for this trip and was not going to be woken by drills in the next room so I asked for another to which they very rudely told me that this was the last one they were going to offer us. (at least the shower was better in the new room). The breakfast was horrible and we preferred the Cafe Metro near times square. Only good think about this hotel is its' location. Also the lady organising things such as tours and broadway tickets etc. was quite helpful. Reception staff need to learn how to smile.

Reviews.Title: “Experience was awful”
Reviews.Author: samsungr700
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel as I saw some goof reviews and was really looking forward to our stay after 7 hours flight from Manchester UK. Arrived at hotel to find we were not greeted well, no smiles, very matter of fact, no information provided about breakfast or papers. Had booked a junior suite, found the suite to be dark and did not look clean, When asked to changed, they offered another room and slamed the telephone before we had ageed. Stayed one night as bathroom light stopped working, my daughter had to have a shower in the dark, shower temperature didnt work, either too hot or too cold, and sound of fans going on all night. Brushed past an old radiator which was too hot and burnt myself on my leg,- not good for children Before the trip had asked the hotel to book transport from JFK to hotel. When we booked with the hotel they wanted us to pay upfront for the transport for return journey and didnot advise that this was a shuttle service, we thought we were getting a private hire just for us. We had to wait 2 hours before the bus arrived, did not mention where they would pick up either and advised the colour of bus to be white or black, when the bus finally came it was silver and at a cost of several international calls later. WE wanted to cancel, but were not given this option. Our return journey was even worse as they picked us up from our new hotel and then took us to another airport to drop some other passengers before going to JFK. With traffice being hectic and leaving us with only 1 hour and half to make it for check in when it should have been 3 hours. The journey from the hotel to the airport took 2 and half hours when it should take 40 minutes. Total disaster, we will not recommend this hotel and the staff need serious training in manners and caring .

Reviews.Title: “Old and out dated”
Reviews.Author: notsofussy186605
Reviews.Content: only good thing about hotel was location. general feeling that the hotel was old and musty, although room was cleaned well every day. Beds ok. Could hear the neighbours shouting. Towels and bathroom had seen better days..... as had the carpets and walls. The coffee in the morning was a nice touch but undrinkable. A budget hotel at best.

Reviews.Title: “Very central and breakfast good but ridiculously hot!”
Reviews.Author: Val093
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from staying in this hotel. The place was clean and I liked the "oldy worldy" feel. However, my main complaint was that the rooms were ridiculously hot, which they did not seem able to rectify and made us wake up feeling completely dehydrated. There were also noises from the various systems during the night especially when running the water, etc. I also found the welcome on arrival rather lacking with no welcome smile and just the request for passports and booking confirmation. I would stay again simply for their location and breakfast but perhaps take some summer night clothes!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful charming hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Satisfiedtraveler60
Reviews.Content: This was a charming hotel. Rooms were very clean quite large for a NY hotel. Also, the price was right and the location was perfect. Macy's was in walking distance and also the theater district. Looking out the window I could see Empire State Building and Madison Square Gardens and Penn Station were also aroung the corner. Had a wonderful stay and the staff was very helpful. Also, Free coffee,tea and muffins evrydy at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a no frills Hotel this would be the one”
Reviews.Author: Lexilou_10
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel could do with redecorating the rooms as the decor looked very tired. The plumbing could do with updating as it was very old and noisey. The good thing was it was close to the Empire State Building and the major department stores.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a short break but......”
Reviews.Author: tulip
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a triple room on the 12th floor with our teenage daughter for 4 nights in Nov. We took a taxi from JFK, it's a flat rate from the airport costing $45 plus the toll fee so comes to about $55. Well worth it or you'll be traipsing abou with your cases for hours! Check in was uneventful apart from the most miserable face EVER behind the front desk. I perservered with my charm and eventuallyher face cracked out the slightest of Mona Lisa smiles..... The lobby is quite ornate but it stops there. Th room was very basic but clean. The bed linen was crisp & clean & the mattress looked new. (I checked on my paranoid quest to check for bed bugs! I didn't find any bugs either...) The shower was almost impossible to get to the right temperature and occasionally the water stopped flowing altogether for several seconds at a time which was distressing with a head full of shampoo. Our toilet blocked and overflowed but this was dealt with swiftly. The heating throughout the hotel is ridiculously hot, we had to put the aircon on in November! There are clanking, hissing & gurgling sounds intermittently throughout the night, I presume from the aged central heating system. In the morning they serve tea, coffee & various muffins for breakfast which were tasty. Went down a treat with the teen. The best bit about this hotel is the location. It's a stones throw from the Empire States building & Macy's. We walked from the hotel to Times Square as well. The taxis run on a meter on the way back to the airport and the roads are often gridlocked so because we had time & subway tickets over we walked to nearby Penn station & got on the A train that goes almost all the way to JFK airport. The driver tells you which stop to get off at then it's $5 for the airtrain. The whole journey took os 1hr 35min from the hotel to airport but I'd allow at least 2 hours in case you get lost. Cheaper than a taxi & quite straightforward. The Wolcott is very basic but ok if you just want a clean bed to sleep in with no frills.

Reviews.Title: “Good value ,great location”
Reviews.Author: billyaylesbury
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights there and it is the same as most other reviews.Good value for money,great for transport and getting about New York.It is a bit dated and there are building work just up the street.,we never heard a sound in room 815.If you are on a budget check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location - good value”
Reviews.Author: denboa12
Reviews.Content: After reading some previous reviews we were expecting a dump - so we were pleasantly surprised at the value of this Hotel. The Wolcott is only about 10-15 minutes walk from Times Square and only 5 minutes from an underground station on W 34th. street - which is serviced by lines from all over the city. (Buy a travel card and zip all over the city, once you've worked out how the NY underground system works. We didn't need a taxi once in 9 days). While there's no denying the Wolcott needs a facelift - it comes with a certain old-age charm. Our room was warm - clean and had the basic essentials. (In-bath shower, dryer, safe, alarm clock, TV etc). Staff are polite but mostly indifferent (typical NY I'd say, but not much good in the 'hospitality' business).

Reviews.Title: “Big room for 3,great location and clean”
Reviews.Author: Marialena P
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my father and my grandfather for 8 nights. At first i wanted to book 2 rooms,in order to have privacy.But after seeing the prices i decided to book a triple. Wolcott seemed the best choice since there are 2 rooms in 1! There was no privacy door but at least i had my own space. Staff was friendly and helpfull! coffe,tea and muffins were nice to begin the day! My room was clean and big.We had daily maid and she could manage the whole mess of the room after shopping. But,you should not expect services of a 4 or 5 star hotel. Just a simple old hotel to have a sleep :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for first time visitors!”
Reviews.Author: anne_lune
Reviews.Content: After a long research to choose the hotel for my first visit to New York City, the Wolcott Hotel seemed to be a good choice, mainly for its location and indeed it was a good selection. The hotel is conviniently located just a few steps from the 5th Av and 3 blocks from the Empire state building. There is a Walgreens store where you can find bottled water as well as a lot of snacks and if you need something more specific, there is a Duane Read store also very near, both of them on the 5th Av. The hotel Staff is really helpful and polite, they helped me with my delayed luggage and also with the booking process (on line). The rooms are nice, in my opinion, there is enough space for two - three people in a twin room and the best thing is taht you have a bathroom onside your room, so no need of sharing! Another really good thing is the the Wolcott hotel offers complimentary coffee, tea and delicious muffins (cranberry and blueberry are a must!) every day, so it's a great way to start your day exploring the city. Also, the hotel is near NYC Penn Station, so if you arrive at Newark, the hotel is just a couple of blocks walk. Regarding the price, I think is ok to be NYC midtown... a little bit hight to young traveler's budget, but it's still reasonable. So, to sum up, I was very pleased with my stay at the Wolcott and would definetely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Just decent”
Reviews.Author: tomK4870
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel to stay in during my 3-week trip in the USA. It easily topped the price of all my booked hotels, so I was expecting something really good. But I suppose this is just what the prices are like in New York City. So what I got for about 250$ times three nights was a decent accomodation, free of bugs or any other nasty stuff, but that was it. The age of the hotel is no secret, it looks nice in the lobby, not so nice everywhere else. The A/C in my room looked quite old and was very noisy. Even when it was off, it managed to keep me up during night - that was when someone above me turned on their A/C, and the water from it started dripping on the casing of mine. Incredibly loud and annoying. The "breakfast"...well, it's nice that for 250 dollars you get some muffins and coffee, but it would be even better if there was a proper place to eat it. Instead you get to sit around the lobby on sofas with bunch of other people. To sum up, very average experience for me. For any future stay in NY, I will be looking for something else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Price, Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: amlawley
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here before and was not disappointed, the stay this time was no different. The maid service was great and free muffins and coffee in the morning saved on breakfast. The staff was great with info and directions, save for the night-time emplyee who left much to be desired in the personality department, and no free internet, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandShark
Reviews.Content: The Walcott Hotel is all about location!A decent hotel off the beat and track but not so much as you are miles away from the tourist sites. The Empire State Building is a 5 min walk, MSG is about a 10 minute walk, Pier 81 is around 25 min walk as is the Port Authority Bus Terminal. Also juts round the corner is a Gray-Line Hop on Hop Off bus stop that takes you to all tourist sites as well. The hotel itself - if i was being slightly picky the interior decor seems a bit dated however, it is very clean. Every time we passed reception a cleaner was very busy with the up keep of the hotel. The reception staff were very friendly and when our toilet broke on the second day it was fixed by the time we returned from site seeing (5 hours later) and when i reported the fault there was no issue in getting maintenance up to the room. A complimentary breakfast is on offer. Its served in the main lobby of the hotel so was slighly awkward coming from the 12th floor and back up with two coffees and muffins. The muffins had varirty and fresh. But if muffins are not your thing then a dunkin dounuts and other outlets are just across the street. The room itself (1201) was a little small for two people with two suitcases. There was one closet but the complimentary safe did take up the majoirty of the space. Therefore it was a slight squeeze when two people were active in the room. Again the bathroom was small and the water temperature was slightly unstable no matter when time of the day we used it. However, the main thing was the temperature was hotter rather than colder. The bed was free of Bed Bugs and the towels changed every day. The AC was perfectly set as well keeping the room nice and cool. Overall, i felt that it was a decent hotel that met our needs for the price range we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms (for NYC), would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: iHeartBklyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in mid-August 2010 and we were very happy with our stay. Prior our trip we had ordered some things online and had contacted the hotel to ask if they would store the things for us, as it was more then 2 weeks until our arrival. There was absolutely no problem with this and they reminded us of the packages when we checked-in and told us that they would be ready to be collected when it best suited us. The room was big with a big closet - perfect to store our shopping bags ;) The shower was somewhat weird, changing from boiling hot to freezing cold.. The bathroom was quite small, but sufficient. The muffins were tasty and the staff was friendly, plus the location was excellent. We would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: macsk12
Reviews.Content: After reading some awful reviews about the state of the rooms and the service, I must say that I was a bit apprehensive about booking the hotel. But being on a budget, we could not pass on the special price of $115 for a junior suite (1 queen and 1 sofa-bed) in such a great location. The 3 of us arrived at the hotel at 7:00 a.m after a long bus ride from Toronto. We thought we could just leave our luggage somewhere in the hotel and then come back to check in later in the afternoon. To our surprise, the extremely helpful front desk person (thank you, Kabine) let us check in. He even invited us to have some breakfast in the lobby. The suite was small but clean as was the bathroom. We did not expect anything fancy and therefore were not disappointed with it. We did not spend any time in the room except to take a shower and sleep anyway. The suite had a t.v in each room but I have no idea whether they worked because we never switched them on. It also had a rollaway bed under the sofa-bed (no mention of it in the room description). We did not find out until just before we left when we were checking under the beds to make sure we did not leave anything behind. I definitely recommend the hotel to anyone on a budget and needing a place close to the Penn Station. You can also call the hotel directly as you might get a better rate than on the internet. Another friend, who was staying in a hostel where she was very unhappy with the state of her room and the shared bathroom, called them and she got a room for $99 when the hotel website had it for $195. That was on August 11.

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't recommend”
Reviews.Author: cade_kim
Reviews.Content: The Wolcott is not somewhere i would recommend to stay. Granted it is in a brilliant location you can't argue with that. We really only used the room to sleep but the bathroom was really disgusting. The drain was just a hole that someone had sledgehammered into the floor, the shower would go from hot to cold so didnt have a decent shower for a week. The staff were rude, minus the girls at the concierge they were very helpful. The airconditioner was so loud it made getting a good night sleep almost impossible but you needed it on as it was so hot. But the bed was comfortable. I would only stay here again as a last resort!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, although our room was...”
Reviews.Author: Kotikisu
Reviews.Content: Great location, although our room was quite shabby. But at that price we didn't even expect more, so overall we were satisfied with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely give this hotel a miss! AWFUL!”
Reviews.Author: HappyDays33
Reviews.Content: I have been to NYC before and was fully aware that the hotels can be pretty basic but none the less ok for the short time you spend in the room. However, this hotel was AWFUL! I would not recommend anyone to stay here. As we arrived the man on reception didn’t even look up which was a bad start. When we got up to our room I was horrified, the smell was disgusting. I knew that the hotel was very old but that was a smell I will never forget. The first thing I did was to buy some glade to get rid of the terrible smell. We didn’t let this ruin our stay, we just made sure we spent as little time as possible in the hotel. As people have said it’s a great location, when you stand outside the hotel and look up you can see the Empire State building which was fantastic. It was an excellent price but next time I will pay a little bit extra to stay in a decent hotel and will definitely give the Wolcott a miss. The worst part of the trip was the last day when we had to use the “shower room” as we had an evening flight and had to check out at 12noon. We were given a key to a dirty shower, a stained toilet and a sink. We decided not to use the shower as it was so dirty and instead had to make do with having a quick wash. This was not ideal especially as we had a 7 hour flight and couldn’t have a shower as the facilities provided were not clean. This hasn’t put me off New York it’s a great City and my time there was fantastic. I did read the reviews on here before I went and noticed they were mixed but I would suggest you do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly, a lovely hotel, in a really good location!”
Reviews.Author: saffy129
Reviews.Content: An excellent find! Stayed here on a performing arts trip to New York with my school, didn't expect such a good place for the money we had paid for the trip! It's spotless and comfortable, in a perfect location, only about one block from The Empire State Building and a 10 minute walk from Times Square! The hotel doesn't have a restaurant but every morning you can go to the lobby and get muffins and tea or coffee included so breakfast was sorted! A perfect hotel for our visit!

Reviews.Title: “Just do it!”
Reviews.Author: CathrineK
Reviews.Content: This is a VERY nice place....I've don't think I have ever stayed at a better budget-hotel. But remember...it is a BUDGET-hotel...so don't go expecting a big plasma-tv, a fancy resturante and a wonderfull veiw....and who cares....it's new york...your not there to stay in your room. The rooms are clean and big, the morning muffins are wonderfull, the staff is so very nice, the rooms got airconditioning and you could not ask for a better location....right outside the hotel lobby you look directly up at Empire State Building. You are between 5th and broadway on 31st....and on the same street as a lovely little wine and chocolate bar (Ayza), that serves wonderfull french and italian food at fine prices....reel new york feeling at this place....we were there so many times....really good when you get enough of burger and fries ;) I would recommed the Wolcott to everyone....very nice place :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for out first time visit to NYC”
Reviews.Author: MaiPVancouver
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 nights at the Wolcott Hotel during a New York heat wave. The hotel is in a great location for a first time visit or returning traveler. It is about a 10-15 minutes walk to Times Square and Madison Sq Gardens. And a couple of blocks from the Empire State Building. The subway is less than 5 minutes away which will take you almost anywhere in the city. The rooms are quite basic but clean and the beds are very comfortable. The hotel is not modern or luxurious but it has lots of character and it is very central and clean. We had air conditioning in our room, it is an old system and a little noisy but it worked and we were only in our room at night time so it was fine. There were 3 of us in one room, 1 queen bed and 1 single bed. It was a great size and just what we needed at a great price. The hotel lobby is lovely and is full of history. There is a computer you can use for $1 for 4 minutes. Another computer is available upstairs from the lobby where you can print your boarding pass for free, this was very useful. The concierge desk booked our return airport shuttle which was cheaper than a taxi and very punctual. We did the open top bus tour which was a great way to get an idea of where all the tourist sights were located. We did both the Empire State and Top of the Rock viewing platforms. Both were great but I would recommend Top of the Rock if you only have time to do one. Top of the Rock is more spacious and modern and has a wonderful view of the Empire State and Central Park. We went on a weekday and didn’t have to queue at all. Overall I would certainly recommend the Wolcott Hotel for those looking for a nice, comfortable, affordable, central base.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: FrisbeeUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights with 2 friends. Had a triple room with 3 separate beds and we can't fault it. Spacious, especially for NYC, cleaned daily, powerful shower with really hot water, view of Empire State building, 2 air con units which were definitely needed as temperatures reached 100. Muffins, tea and coffee are available in the morning which is unusual for NYC and also free use of a computer to check in for flights and print boarding passes. Reception staff were really friendly and accommodating. The only issue we did encounter was concierge - she didn't know what was going on in NYC for 4th July celebrations and was unable to help in any way and didn't seem to know NYC! I think we just chose the wrong day to ask as the concierge seemed to change daily but I can't comment on the others. Location wise it is very close to Macy's and the Empire State which does have a lot of ticket touts outside for tourist buses and the Skyride, the closest subway station is 3 blocks away. Based on my experience, I would definitely recommend this hotel, excellent value for money

Reviews.Title: “Mini suite perfect for grandmother/grandson trip to NYC”
Reviews.Author: PSAtlanta
Reviews.Content: The Wolcott Hotel is well located, comfortable and fun. My 11 year old grandson and I stayed in a mini suite with two rooms, two tv's, a queen bed in one room and a twin with a trundle bed in the other. You could easily accommodate parents with 2 children. It has a large bathroom with a tub and shower. We walked to Macy's and the Empire State Building and the subway. There are many fast food restaurants nearby, a camera store and several pharmacies. There is a coffee/tea and muffin service in the lobby each morning and guests seemed to be from all over the world.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovemyholidaysalot
Reviews.Content: a friend and i stayed at this hotel in may the weekend of the 7th May. the hotel was very close to the empire state bulding and other major sights. the roomwe had was a twin room and was nice and spacious. although the bathroom was a little small and the shower would turn hot without you knowing but didnt burn. but other than those niggles this hotel was lovely. the cleaner came in every morning and made the beds and placed clean towels in the bathroom for us. the hotel lobby every morning had free muffins; i think there were about 4 diffrent types which were really nice. with the muffins you got free tea and coffee too we didnt have to even buy breakfast after having this. times square wasnt too far away and was walking distance. when we were too shattered to walk back to the hotel a taxi wasnt too expensive from times square so its very central. the hotel was value for money. if i go back to new york i will stay here again. the lobby staff were very helpfull when we needed directions and a transfer back to JFK. great hotel and id reccommend it to anyone going to new york. there was also a compuetr in the lobby area for using the internet which was great it was very fast and for about 1 doller i think i got 4 minutes its good for a quick email back home or searching for info.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a New York stay”
Reviews.Author: mgt2010
Reviews.Content: It would be middling anywhere else, but it was quite a deal for New York. We go up to New York a lot, and frequently use Hotwire. For this trip, hotel prices seemed very high, so we decided on this place when we found it on Orbitz for under $200. It is definitely a three star hotel. The room was quite alright. The lobby area was a little less than ideal; the carpet in the breakfast area was pretty dirty, but other than that it was quite ornate. The location (just a few blocks from the Empire State Building) is ideal for our needs - we could walk everywhere. It's in a small Koreatown - we found a good Korean cafeteria.

Reviews.Title: “amazing location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: dolphin60_40
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel for a week and was very suprised for a 2 star hotel the rooms are large, really close to the empire state building and close the penn station (3 blocks) where the airport train comes in, muffins and tea/coffee for breakfast. just off broadway(road) and about 20 mins or less to get to time square room was serviced everyday and had aircon unit, very helpful staff on reception and good sized bathroom. i would say it is a 3 star european equivalent in new york. good value for money and on a quiet street. the lobby is amazing with chandeliers and stunning ceiling design.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for money”
Reviews.Author: CandidKiwi
Reviews.Content: Well siutated on the corenr of 5th and West 31st street the Wolcott offers exceptional value for money. It is a little tired and the facilities are basic but it is clean and secure and offers a great staging area to explore down town NYC. Coffee and muffins in the morning set you up for the day and are included in the low (by NYC standards) tarrif.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: explorer60_10
Reviews.Content: Built in 1904 the hotel retains much of its original features including the very ornate lobby. We were on the 12th floor. The room was spacious and clean and the bed comfortable. Only down side with the room was it was too warm and the air conditioner was noisy and inefficient. The windows did open but at night that just allowed additional traffic noise. Also the room had a strong smell of bleach from the bathroom. The hotel does not have a restaurant but with the number of nearby food outlets that was no problem. Included in the room rate was coffee and muffins in the lobby for breakfast which for us was quite adequate to start the day as they were large and filling. The chief selling point of the hotel was its central location very near the Empire State building and Penn station. It isn't the Ritz but then we were not paying those prices. Despite budget prices it did not feel like a budget hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful and we felt it represented good value for money. I wouldn't like to stay there in the height of summer as the heat in the room would have been untolerable -acceptable in May.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money!”
Reviews.Author: DonegalAnon
Reviews.Content: A group of 7 of us stayed here in November 2009 and thought this was a great little hotel. Check in was fast and efficient and the staff were lovely! The rooms were clean and spacious even though the decor was a little outdated! Although we did have a flat screen tv in our room! The only fault was that the bath was tiny but the shower was great so that made up for it. But it might not suit people who are unable to shower and need to use a bath! The hotel didnt have a bar or restaurant but there is a great little irish bar down the street called o reillys and they serve food there too! Even though the hotel doesnt do breakfast the free coffee and muffins in the lobby were gorgeous and kept us filled up until lunch! The hotel's location is FANTASTIC only a few minutes walk from times square and all the shops and its practically beside the empire state building! If there are any tours or trips you want to do there is someone in the lobby everyday who can organise everything for you which is so handy! Overall this hotel is great value for money, a real little hidden gem and we cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Volcanic saviour”
Reviews.Author: wellsfamily_10
Reviews.Content: Travelled to NYC the day before the volcano erupted - supposed to be a 5 night trip but turned out to be 9 nights. Once we heard the news that there maybe a possibility that we would not get home for days, I spoke with the staff at the Wolcott who reassured me we could stay as long as we needed. This was very reassuring under the circumstances. I found the hotel staff very helpful and gave us as much info as they could about the situation. We did not have a cell phone and they were more than happy to let us use their phone for local calls to the airline. We actually had a great time and was very pleased with the hotel and location. Our Polish cleaner was so friendly and and very concerned about us. I would certainly recommend this hotel to my friends & family for a bargin stay in NYC. Bathroom was tiny but then who stays in their bathroom when in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Did the trick for me”
Reviews.Author: tobHelsinki
Reviews.Content: Rooms were ok, also bathroom, shower etc. They were clean, and the hotel location was good as well, and that was what I was looking for. I guess, for NYC this was good value for money. Sleep quality was low as there were lots of young people slamming doors until the early hours. Service was basic, but did the trick for me. If you are on a budget, that’s the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Aweful service”
Reviews.Author: LightningMcQueen79
Reviews.Content: The best thing was when I checked out. The service was terrible! I was looking forward to good service seeing as I was staying there for 2 weeks but it was the worst service I had ever come across. The people were unfriendly, unwelcoming, and some were rude. I didn't get 1 good night's sleep because of the noise of doors slamming and people talking. The location was aweful too! The nearby streets were covered in rubbish. The cleaners were good though. They cleanedand tidied my room really well every day

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, nice price”
Reviews.Author: MarkLBoston
Reviews.Content: The Wolcott is nicely located near Herald Square, a short walk from Penn Station. For the location and the room quality, the rates were a good value. The lobby is attractive and shows off the hotel's long history. Check-in was businesslike - but I've never been asked for photo ID's of everyone in the room before. Rooms are good sized with all the basic amenities. There's a large safe and small ironing board in the closet. Windows were not air-tight, letting in a little noise but not enough to be a problem. The room and the bathroom were clean. Bath furnishings were old and oddly placed - I had to lean sideways over the sink or reach back for the toilet paper - but everything worked satisfactorily. The twin beds were small but comfortable. Complimentary, tasty muffins and coffee were available in the lobby in the morning - nice! Wifi was $10 a day.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was an absolute gem!!”
Reviews.Author: Madison72
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel simply through reading about it on the internet, making my choice based on reviews, and on the fact that it offered twin beds (traveled with my 20-year old son who had also not been before). I had never been to NYC so it was a total shot in the dark. I worried that because it is budget-priced it would be pretty rotten, being in NYC and all. What a great surprise - it was just terrific! It has a small but ornate lobby, our room was cozy and comfortable, warm, nice high high ceilings, clean as could be, nice fresh bedding and linens, QUIET. The staff were all so pleasant and helpful. The morning muffins and coffee/tea were so handy and good. The location is wonderful - we walked everywhere, plus took the subway from a close-by station. Everything you need is provided by the hotel, including things not mentioned in their advertising, such as a hair dryer, and there were many stores and restaurants within steps of the door. This hotel was so warm and welcoming to come back to after a long day checking out the city. Our stay was thoroughly enjoyable for us both.

Reviews.Title: “Empire State of Mind”
Reviews.Author: LeVisitant
Reviews.Content: Hotel superbly located in midtown Manhattan, two minutes walk to Empire State Building. Not particularly cheap but New York hotels tend to rack-rent anyway. It's extremely comfortable if not pre-possessing, e.g. bedroom didn't look as if it had been revamped in quite a while. A most comfortable bed however. One caveat is lack of dining options including breakfast. They only serve coffee and pastries in the lobby. The silver lining is that one gets to breakfast at those terrific delis on adjoining 5th Avenue. Broadway is just around the corner and there's a authentic New York style Irish pub - 'O'Reilly's' steps from the front door (no bar onsite). I would definitely recommend this hotel if you're doing the quintessantial New York trip i.e. shopping, sightseeing and going to a show

Reviews.Title: “a strange little place”
Reviews.Author: bostonenglish
Reviews.Content: Hotel Wolcott is an excellently located hotel with some strange little eccentricities about it. The hotel is located 2 blocks from the Empire State Building and very close to the Bolt Bus, Megabus and on a direct subway line from the Chinatown Buses. It is also very close to Heralds Square and only 10 blocks from Times Square. Inside the hotel the lobby is astounding!! Beautifully decorated and well kept. The desk staff were very pleasant. Our first room (on the 6th floor) however was very disapointing. There was almost no natural light, the room was very small and the water coming from the taps was brown. After complaining we were given a much nicer room (12th floor) with plenty of natural light, clear water and much more space! Both rooms were very clean. The offer of a free coffee and a muffin in the morning was also too good to pass up. In general the Wolcott is a good place to stay if you're on a budget. It's cheap and clean with a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “not consistent”
Reviews.Author: tellingmytruth
Reviews.Content: I know tourist love this place because of it's cost and location. i come here 2x yrly for business trip. We are offered bigger discount thru our convention show, and that's the ONLY reason we stay here. Rooms vary, bathrooms size varies. Some tv channels are snowy. Internet every time, has only worked in certain areas of hotel. but they tell us, they don't know why it's not working, and make us call internet carrier, wasting hours on this. Staff, basically is the worst NY i could care less attitude. In summer there's no air conditioning in hallways or elevator (but yes in rooms). look for restaurants off Madison just south of here, within a couple of blocks. love 2 that are on 30th or 29th off Madison. Oh, and beds are horribly hard. i line up all the extra pillows and sleep on them. but know, that every room is different, so ask for something else if you don't like. i do like that i've never had an issue w/ noise from other rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay..won't stay any where else!”
Reviews.Author: Hideout
Reviews.Content: I celebrated my 50th birthday by meeting 2 HS friend in NYC. We stayed at the Wolcott as it has a 2 room unit with 3 twin beds..perfect for the three of us. Beds were VERY comfortable, bathroom was clean, rooms were a comfortable size, extra pillows and blankets in the closet, staff was really friendly, Dunkin Donuts right across the street, CVS for munchies and Burger King and Pizza right around the corner, really close walking distance to Penn Station. Price was great! Both my friends were happy with the room too. one from NYC was quite surprised at the value we got for the price. We styed on a Saturday night and not a sound to be heard. Plenty of hot water too. Beautiful lobby too.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anskula
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated right next to Empire State building and it's quite close to Macy's and metroline. You can easily walk to the stores and sites on the Fifth Avenue or wander till Times square in north or Union Square in south. Hotels breakfast consists of coffee, tea and a selection of muffins, nothing else. So it's fine if you're not looking for a huge breakfast, but if you are into crispy morning bacon, this is not your place. The hotel has a suttle service to the airports (22dollars per person). The room was not too big but it had all the basic elements you need. The room was clean but style of the room could be updated. The bath tub was smaller than normal and you ended up hugging the shower curtain. Because the weather was cooler, the heater was on and making anoying noises from time to time.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your wallet...”
Reviews.Author: honestly56
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews on hotels. This time I have to. When I got home I found out that they had billed me for the room and were trying to bill the agency that arranged the reservation with their usual account number. TRYING TO DOUBLE DIP. Then these clowns called me in the middle of my three day stay to say there was nothing in my room, and would I need it. It was paid for! (Twice if they could). No heat for three nights. Good luck getting of the shower with no heat on a Feb. night. When I walked in I thought, great rate, charming lobby. Now I am warning everyone of their criminal activities. One disappointed customer. They have lost the NY agency they had an account with. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: NINE63
Reviews.Content: I booked in for 1 night because of a doctor's appointment the next day and stayed an extra night, out of necessity, for further tests and I was just too tired to look for another hotel - the rooms are shaby and run down and not too clean - the 1st room I was given was ok size wise but so cold I had to move to a much small room that was warmer, but not because of the better heat - but because there was only 1 window - and this room was the same price as the other larger one - for the freezing cold weather that we had they were very stingy with the heat and you can't control it yourself - its an old fashion radiator that you can't adjust at all even though it had knobs that you should have been able to turn for more heat. This is one hotel I'll never stay in again - gave me a Hilton any day - you get what you pay for - I was also charged a d Javits tax on c/o and never given an explaintion for it - what a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Old, Warm hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trontroland
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying here and would probably stay here again as the location is very convenient for the types of activities I enjoy. Penn Station and Madison Square Garden are very close -about a 10 minute walk. Also in the vicinity is the Empire State Building which you may not know is open very late for visiting. Good pizza, deli's , and breakfast stops. There was an interesting looking wine bar right across the street that I regret not trying. The rooms are "cozy" but can get very, very warm with no way to adjust the temp. except opening the window. And as another poster mentioned, the outside noise can be loud, but never did the inside noise of the hallway or slamming doors bother me.

Reviews.Title: “AVERAGE all over”
Reviews.Author: PikeyJay
Reviews.Content: Awesome location in the heart of new York,walking distance to times square, empire state, maddison square gardens and more. Could do with a referb as lights and toilets weren't working, and the rooms although cleaned everyday could have been better maintained! Staff at the desk were grumpy most of the time and didn't make us feel welcome. Overall not bad if you can put up with being grunted at and fixing your own toilet and lights. What it lacks in service it makes up for in location-a good base for an exploring traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Good for location & facilities, but not too good for room”
Reviews.Author: DomingosLao
Reviews.Content: It's low cost, not too expensive You may find metro within 5 mins walking distance, and the station could be consider a BIG station, because u can find lots of lines overthere, and only 1 station to Time Square. There got one Subway at the corner of the street, and lots of supermarkets, and so on....the location is very good and safe... but the room.....actually, not too bad, but the first room, the electricity got problems...==', so we have subject to another room and upgraded!!!, then it's better!!! the upgraded one is great, a king-size double bed, and one twin bed.....^^! and there got FREE breakfast, but only just "buffin", coffee & tea...dont have many choice, and even the breakfast is located in the lobby ~~ the staff are very helpful, and the cost....is satisfied... becuase you cant find any room is that "LOW COST" in the area which near Time Square & Metro Station.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a nice hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine_Mark
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wolcott for 3 nights from 19th November Thru 22nd. After severing a 14 hour delay on our flight from Manchester UK to Newark we arrived at the hotel at 03:30am, the guy on reception was very friendly and already knew about our delay as they had checked the incoming flight data. Our room was on the 12th floor right next to the elevator which we were expecting to be noisy, however we could not hear the elevators operating or people waiting for them. The room itself was small but par for New York sized rooms. We had a firm double bed with a pillow each, we prefer to have two pillows each so a quick call to reception in the morning and we had extra pillows. There is a smallish flat screen TV on the wall. The bathroom was smaller than others we have had in New York, the sink was under the mirror and tucked away in a tight gap, I struggled to get my face close enough to wash in the mornings. We bath is a ¾ length tub, so don’t expect a good long soak after a hard days sightseeing and shopping. There is a shower over the tub which we found adequate, however you have to turn the tap fully on and wait a few minutes for the water to warm up. I had a big shock when I first stood under it. All in all, the room was what we needed, a place to lay your head at night. An added bonus of this hotel is they provide free coffee and muffins in the morning down in the lobby. The best thing about this hotel is its location, just 3 blocks south of the empire state building and on 5th avenue. Macy’s and 34th street are just 5 mins walk away and Madison Square Garden just a 10 minute stroll for those sporting events and concerts.

Reviews.Title: “Would recomend, already booked to stay here in June 2010”
Reviews.Author: springwellangel
Reviews.Content: Staff really friendly, room was spotless. Stayed at the back of the hotel so no view but also no noise. Ideal location for shopping, sightseeing and dining.

Reviews.Title: “New York City :)”
Reviews.Author: NursingStudents
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! We will definitly stay here again. Big corner room with a great view of the Empire State Bldg, very clean over all; the beds were comfy; the bathroom is small, especially the tub but overall adequate & in the room :) We stayed in room 820 which had 3 twin beds with one of the beds in a seperate room; it also had 4 windows & 2 air conditioners with a window in the bathroom too. We arrived early so the staff allowed us to check our baggage in a secured area, but they also have luggage lockers for .50 cents that is refunded. Excellent & helpful staff. Room was cleaned well every day and they serve yummy muffins and coffee & tea in the lobby for breakfast. Lots of dining & ATM's nearby. Always felt safe, even at 11:30 pm. Close to many tourist sights & shopping & the subway (which we navigated easily). Phew! I hope I covered all I wanted to express. Overall great time!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PKB7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wolcott for 6 nights - the hotel is in a great location - close to the Empire State, Times Sq, and Macy's. We were allocated a smoking room, although we stated non-smoking, however the staff were really helpful and moved us straight away. The rooms are a little dark, and not very modern - but we were only there to sleep, and the beds were comfy. Overall a good hotel for city sightseeing given the value and location!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dan-Hfx
Reviews.Content: We spend 4 nights here, its a very clean hotel with friendly staff. Its 3 blocks from MSG and 2 from the Empire State Building, about a 15 minute walk to Times Square and 10 from the nearest Subway Stations (3 lines), we would stay again any time. The bad was low water pressure when trying to shower and the room hot, we ran the air conditioner to cool off the room , in December! but over all if you don't want anything fancy its a nice little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Passable”
Reviews.Author: asrosen
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel. Very large room (suite) though rough around the edges. Free continental breakfast in the lobby, though it was pretty much a madhouse and hard to find any place to sit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, and wont break the bank”
Reviews.Author: KahlessNorwich
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wolcott, and would recommend it to anyone. The rooms are large and clean. Maid service everyday. All the staff are very friendly. Located 2 blocks away from the Empire State Building, so its very conviniently placed. Only the bathroom was a little on the small side. Otherwise the rooms are very clean. The entrance foyer is particularily impressive for a budget hotel. Complimentary coffee and muffins for breakfast as well. This hotel makes a great base for exploring Manhattan. Not far from Macy's, and Herald Square.

Reviews.Title: “Location,location,location at great price”
Reviews.Author: GRANTHAMGRETA
Reviews.Content: If location is important to you and you're not trying to impress anyone on this stay but are more interested in seeing the sites and spending your hard earned cash on enjoying yourself rather than a swish hotel, then this place is just what you need. I had quite low expectations after reading some reviews, but it was just fine. Very old school hotel - but if you like a bit of character this has it. Staff friendly and helpful - but the location makes it - and for the price, don't think you could do any better - literally around the corner from Macys, Empire State, Madison Sq Garden, Jack Demsey's pub (where the men can watch all the english soccer matches. live )couple of blocks from Time Square and a subway close by if travelling further afield. The hotel also has lockers available for 50 cents for storing your luggage on your last day if you have a late flight . If I had to make a criticism it was the small bathroom - but who cares - its New York!

Reviews.Title: “Trustworthy hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: Anteroo
Reviews.Content: After some new york-hotel-research on the Internet we found this one. This was our first trip to the Big Apple so we did not have any expectations, but the price seemed extremly reasonable considering the location of the hotel so we went for it. The experience in a nut shell was positive. Very tidy looking lobby and corridors and a sympathetic room with everything a basic visitor needs. Who "lives" in their hotel room anyway? Next I will line up som + and - : + Nice and tidy looking interior + Enough fresh-looking room (and corridors that smelled like a 5-star hotel ;) ) + TV + safe + Price and easy payment methods + Location - The staff seemed a bit bored and in some way rude (don´t let that affect your stay) All in all I give the hotel an 8 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find in Midtown NYC, at a Great Price.”
Reviews.Author: ladyDL
Reviews.Content: I along with my brother, my 21 year old son, and his girlfriend visited NYC in Oct, 2009. After finding no NY hotels for less than $250 a night, I was about to give up and go to San Antonio, TX instead. But I said a silent prayer, searched ORBITZ one more time and the Wolcot Hotel came up. At first glance you can tell hotel is a bit old, but that only adds to the pre-war New York ambiance. We stayed in a junior suite and it was absolutely spacious and comfortable. Twin beds were a bit firm, but after a full day of busy NY walking & sightseeing, I slept like a baby. The Wolcott is literally in the heart of Midtown. Put on good walking shoes, and you're only a few minutes from Empire State, MACY's Times Square, Madison Square Garden and other sights.

Reviews.Title: “lovely little hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: emmalouiseRotherham
Reviews.Content: stayed at the wolcott hotel for 6 nights and have no complaints at all. when we arrived we were greeted by friendly staff who gave us a lovely view of the empire state building from our room .hotel very clean and cosy clean towels every day. we had a tripple room which was very comfortabe with three twin beds one in a little archway in the room. had no problems with the water temperature at all the bathroom was a little tiny but not a problem at all.the hotel is in a great central location and the staff are really nice and very helpful.in a morning the coffee and muffins provided by the hotel are very nice.would definatley return to this hotel infact looking to return next year cant wait.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel with range of opportunities!”
Reviews.Author: DaveNeveyAllies
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, almost next to the Empire State building, loads of restaurants and eateries al around the hotel. It has more than it says on its website. It has a Gym and Business Centre. Rooms were very comfortable and had a safe. Bathroom was large! Concierge is the best service in my experience and of all the trips I have been on. Overall, an excellent place for an excellent price. Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: meleth
Reviews.Content: Near the Empire State Building, this was a good, clean and central hotel. The coffee and muffins for breakfast were great!! I thought it was expensive until I looked at other hotels which were double the price. It's not a fancy hotel, but who needs a fancy hotel in New York? There's so much to do we were hardly in our hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “You pay for what you get. Average/good”
Reviews.Content: I went to New York on a school trip in October half term for 5 days and we stayed at the Wolcott. First impressions: nice area, central, literally down the road from Macys and a clean and rather grand reception area. BUT....WHEN WE ARRIVED THERE WAS ALREADY 2 OTHER SCHOOL PARTIES THERE so be warned....it is a favourite for large youth groups. I was in a room of 3 and immediatley through the door there was a bed. There was then a bathroom and a doorway to the large room with 2 beds, a tables, t.v. and dressing tables. Prehaps not the newest and modernest interior but it was clean. The bathroom was smallish with a bath/shower toliet and sink but it was satisfactory and had been cleaned. The hotel does offer free coffee and muffins in the morning but due to the large number of school groups, i couldn't get near it. Honestly though, the tales about bed bugs and cock roaches are rubbish. our room was throughly cleaned daily and towels and laundry were fresh and clean. I am a hygine freak and honestly had no issues. Location wise, i think its difficult to beat. Macys it literally a strole away as with the empire state. A 10 minute walk to time square and easy access to subway stations. Just round the corner is a superb 24hour breakfast place called SPEEDY'S. It is actually brilliant anc not too pricy. It does self seleection cooked breakfasts, continental as well as frozen yougharts smoothies and all beverages imaginable. I got a bagle and large juice for under $5!!!! Its great. The hotel also has a shop connected to it, accessable from inside the hotel so water can be picked up cheaply at the start and end of each day. View wise, only the front rooms get them but for me, it was not a big deal as i could walk out of the hotel and be anywhere very quickly. A friends room has a broken lavatory, when they returned after a day out, it had been fixed. Didnt interact alot with the staff but all seemed pleasant, and willing to help. They organised a room to store out suitcases during the day as we had a night flight. Honestly though, im a fussy teenage girl and i thought i was absolotly fine and definately clean && anyway, when you in New York, you have to be pretty sad to spent alot of time in the hotel. our days were so packed and we were so tiered it was literally a place to wash, sleep and change. Especially if you are going here on a school trip take my word it is fine and clean and actually rather a nice surprise. And also last time i went to nyc ii stayed in the embassy suites (part of the hilton chain) in lower manhattan with my parents so its not as if i dont know whats nice and whats not. There were also locks and latches on every door and a safe in every room so there was never a time when i felt unsafe with my friends or on my own within the hotel. enjoy your trip:) x

Reviews.Title: “Great City but not a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Midor
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about the Wolcott Hotel is its location close to many otf the tourist attractions,the hotel is old, noisey and in dire need of a makeover,If you intend to go to this hotel make sure you take earplugs as the walls are paper thin and vibrate when the room doors are shut,seems like many guests take delight in slamming doors at 330 in the morning. The reception staff are indicative of the general attitude of many of the people who live and work in New York, they are sullen with little or no manners and are not all that friendly, our check out from the hotel was done in silence, not even a "thank you" or "hope you enjoyed your stay" was offered. Use a yellow cab to get to the airport as the driver of the shuttle bus company used by the hotel only knows one speed and that is "pedal to the metal" with scant regard to the comfort of the passengers or road safety. We would go back to NYC but not back to the Wolcott

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful, a little dated but it is 105 years old!!”
Reviews.Author: montsinperth
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Wolcott from 28/9 - 7/10 in a junior suite (room 624) room was clean and bed and bedding good.Hot water in bathroom temperamental but plenty of it.Muffins were O.K. in the mornings but a little stodgy, better of going to a diner (there are heaps nearby).Laundry was good and easy to use and gym was O.K.My main complaint if any was that there is no free WIFI, other than that it was quite good for the price ($185.00 us/nt).Hope this helps.Oh, ps the location is excellent 1 block to empire state,2 blocks to Madison sq. and a subway stops 5 and ten minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “If they'd fix the water problem this would be just about perfect”
Reviews.Author: NorthernTraveler37
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wolcott for three days in October. I stayed in a two twin room. The size of the room was fine and it was clean and comfortable. The hotel has a lot of character and the desk clerk was willing to accomodate an early check in. My only issue was with the water in the shower and sink. With the sink we'd get hot water from the cold tap and cold water from the hot tap. Once I figured that out, it wasn't a big deal. The bigger issue was the shower. The water would either randomly stop flowing (or reduce the flow to a trickle) or it would become extremely cold. Adjusting the hot and cold usually resulted in another burst of cold water or being scalded. If I had been staying longer this would have been more of a problem. I am assuming this is just one of the quirks of an older hotel. No, this isn't the Marriott. This hotel was built in 1904 so it isn't luxurious or brand new. But it is affordable, clean, close to a subway stop, and in a location that allows you to walk back and forth to TImes Square or the theater district if you so choose. The coffee and muffins in the lobby are really good, too. I'd definitely stay here again even with the water issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: classychic01
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here for 5 nights. We arrived late on Saturday and the check in was smooth and swift, staff on the reception were very helpfull even printing out information for us from their computer. We had a room for three, twin in one room with a little room off this with a single bed in it. The room was clean and made up every day, bathroom small but sufficient with as much hot water as we needed, clean towels every day. The hotel was built in 1904, so yes if you look close enough it has a cracks here and there but it is full character, coffee and muffins in the morning are a great bonus. It is well placed in the city for everything shops, subway,Empire state building etc. Could not fault this hotel, ideal and fit for purpose as a base in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful historic hotel centrally located in NY for a very fair price!”
Reviews.Author: arrowheadhunter
Reviews.Content: The Wolcott Hotel is a 100 year old piece of art with beautiful lobby, large rooms, two blocks from Empire State Building, walking distance to theaters, central park, Broadway and Times Square. Very nice staff, good theater tickets and prices fron hotel. Donut-Coffee shop, pizza, and other handy stores just across street and around the corner on 5th Avenue. Price and locatiion was reasonable for area. Window air/heat units, shower over tub, flat screen tv, large room and large separate bath. Quieter than the Times Square area and more relaxing. Highly recommend the hotel for future visits to NY.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but room was disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: Stoney510
Reviews.Content: The place felt dirty - like it needed a good scrubbing. From our window, we saw that the the outside of the building was covered in soot and dirt. We did not mind the small room, but the bathroom was horrible. Barely enough room to turn around from the sink to the toilet! The toilet would not stop running in the middle of the night...so we fixed it ourselves with a paperclip. It was impossible to control the water temperature in the shower. This hotel has wonderful potential because of its architectural beauty and details. Unfortunately, someone cut corners and went cheap during the last remodel.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and brilliant!!”
Reviews.Author: lauraw1983
Reviews.Content: i went with 2 friends for 10days and stayed at this hotel. i loved it,the rooms were very big and clean. it was in a excellent location,15mins walk from times sq, i would deffiantly recommend anyone to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great First Experience”
Reviews.Author: Agatag
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was great, the location was even better, right next to the Empire State Building. My family came from Italy and were very impressed. We had read some reviews regarding the hotel, but it turned out to be even better. The staff was great, they were always available and the rooms were clean and well kept. It's an older hotel with a lot of history and charm. If you are looking for something from the past, this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant staff, Good Price, Good sized rooms for NYC”
Reviews.Author: zombiesatemy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last month and this hotel did the job just fine. The staff was friendly and even remembered my name and they would say goodnight to us when we'd come in the hotel to go to bed at 4am. lol. Realy nice guys. The hotel was a good size for NYC standards (by other city standards the room would be considered tiny but for NYC it was a really good size). The room and bathroom were clean. I really enjoyed my stay there, although we werent there much. I would stay here again next time in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Good compromise”
Reviews.Author: schuminou
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very good compromise in new York where the room price is so expensive. It is located at 5 minute walk from the Empire State Building in a quiet street. The room was spacious and the bed was comfortable. Unfortunately, people don't care about you during the night and you are woke up almost every night because of people coming back from party. The breakfast is not a real breakfast since the hotel only puts some Muffins and coffe on a table at the entrance. There is no table, no chair, ...

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: zperson
Reviews.Content: Front desk not helpful. Room poorly maintained--plumbing , and water temperature varies. Internet must pay extra. Although cheaper, value is not there. Would not recommend. Computer (business center) is too slow and thus requires constantly feeding dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and central”
Reviews.Author: RichardWiggett
Reviews.Content: My and my girlfriend started here on our round the world trip. This hotel was clean and tidy in the lobby area with really helpful staff. Breakfast was coffee and muffins with orange juice as well. The rooms where old but clean. the entrance is nice with marble everywhere. Stayed 4 nights and its smack bang in the middle of everything. a short walk will take you to the main attractions if you need a train then the metro is 2 blocks down. Good place to stay for a couple of night but not for a long 2 week holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location!”
Reviews.Author: ahunt1976
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from NYC where I stayed 9 days at Wolcott Hotel with my friend and her 6 y.o. daughter. We stayed in room 1124. When we got to the hotel and opened the door to our Junior Suite that had 2 rooms, my first impression was that it was way too small but since it was the best price in Manhattan that I could find and an awesome location I wasn't upset. After all we spent little time at the hotel. There's always something good and something not so good about each hotel and though I was completely satisfied with Wolcott I wanted to share some things with those who are looking for a hotel in NYC. Had I known some of those tips I would have brought conditioner with me. :) What I liked about Wolcott: 1) Great location. It's very close to Empire State building on one side of the street and to Penn Station, Macy's and 5th Ave on the other. For the lovers of Korean food there's lots of Korean restaurants on the 32nd St right next to the 31st St where Wolcott is located. There's Subway & Dunkin Donuts on the other side of the street from Wolcott. 2) Has 2 TVs in Junior Suite, one in each room. Has one queen bed in one room and 2 twin beds in the other (one of the beds is a roll-away bed that is hidden underneath another bed) . Junior Suite has 2 closet with plenty of hangers. 3) There is an iron and a safe in the room. 4) They have coffee and several kinds of muffins for breakfast in the morning. (There's not much room in the lobby to have breakfast so we always took our breakfast to the room). 5) Towels were changed daily even when we didn't leave them on the floor. 6) There's a tour agent in the lobby from 8am to 8pm that offers great one day trips to Washington D.C., Boston and Philadelphia. I went to Washington D.C. and Boston with them and absolutely loved the tours. 7) The sheets were clean and beds were very comfortable. And now some things that could be better... 1) There was only shampoo in the bathroom. No conditioner or shower gel. 2) There was no coffee maker in the room. 3) No fridge in the room 4) The hotel doesn't have a pool and I don't think that they have a gym either. 5) The air conditioners in the rooms were not working well. I always had mine at 75F but you had to keep in on all night to get the room temperature to 75F by morning and they turn air conditioners off during the day so it gets warm in the room. 6) No free high speed internet. The only free internet I found in NYC was on 5th Ave (near Times Square) in an Information Center but you can only use it for 15 min and the lines are always long there. Overall, I did like my stay at Wolcott and if I ever go back to NYC I'll definitely stay here again since the location is great and their prices are unbeatable. I would recommend this hotel to those who is looking for a budget hotel and doesn't plan on spending too much time in the room while in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Take The Bad With The Good”
Reviews.Author: nicholeandbrett
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon last year. I have stayed in many a different hotels in New York and we tried this for my husbands very first trip there. The price was right and the location was very good. I enjoyed the entrance and the old feel of the hotel. The staff was incredibly helpful and very nice to us. They helped us find some wonderful places to eat and called transportation limos for us. The biggest problem I had was that they were remodeling while we stayed and found it to be quite noisy on the days we wanted to sleep in. We also found that the smell of plaster and paint could be overwhelming at times and a bit unbearable even after you had been out all day and needed to breath...which proved to be hard at time. However, the issues we had were not lasting and they have probably stopped remodeling at this point. We had a great stay and if you need anything, they are so willing to make sure your stay is the best it can be!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Eliina
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 11 nights in July and the hotel was absolutely perfect for us. Before making reservations I had read many rewievs since I wanted to find the perfect, afordable hotel for our first trip to New York. The location was absolutely perfect with many sights within walking distance and the room was spacious and clean. We were very satisfied with the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at the Wolcott”
Reviews.Author: GarfieldScotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights with a school party of 25. Staff were very helpful with check in being very slick. Rooms were more than satisfactory for a budget hotel in the centre of the city. They were a good size and very clean. Very limited breakfast of muffins and coffee offered (They are free). These are offered in the lobby and there is no separate dining room so finding a seat can be rather tricky. Hotel was excellent for our needs with the location being perfect for exploring the city. I would have no problem with taking a school group here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: andybear
Reviews.Content: This was my 1st visit and I would definatley stay there again .

Reviews.Title: “Could do & needs to be much better”
Reviews.Author: pam1948
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment this hotel was. The Wolcott is situated in a fantastic location for the sights of New York city with the Empire State building just around the corner. Unfortunately it leaves much to be desired. The rooms are small, dingy and not too clean. Our actual room smelt of moth balls until we placed the bed covers in the wardrobe! The sheets and towels were clean but the room itself looked and felt dirty. Even after showering each day I still did not feel clean. The room itself lacked shelves, tea making facilities, and good enjoyable t/v channels. Having to pay to use the internet was poor. The hotel entrance was very elegant even though the carpet could have done with a good clean! Free coffee and cakes in the morning was a nice touch but after a long day sight seeing tea and coffee making facilities in the room would have been more appreciated. The staff were helpful and friendly. All In all this hotel needs a complete re-furbishment and also its owners need to look into the comfort and needs of its clients more than the money it can make from them. If and when this happens it might just get a good write up. Sorry Woolcott but that is my impression, wished it could have been better!

Reviews.Title: “Location and price can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: apple1234567
Reviews.Content: For what all you get, I've heard that some of the rooms in NYC are very small and pricy. For this hotel's cost, the room was nice, clean and large. There was no noise during the busy holiday season of our stay. The view was not so great from our room but the location of the hotel was close to Macy's, and we walked from Times Square. Not bad at all!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - NYC”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowAngie
Reviews.Content: Just back from NYC which we were staying at the Hotel Wolcott could not fault this hotel, our room was spacious and we actually had a extra single bed, in the rooms we had TV, air conditioning which we needed as the weather was really warm in the high 80's, it has had an iron, iron board and hair dryer. The shower and bath was a separate room and the towels were cleaned on a daily basis and also the rooms cleaned. Each morning you could go down to reception for coffee and muffins which was as nice touch. Location was great just a few blocks from Empire State Building, Macy's, Madison Sq Gardens and Broadway. Had a great time in NYC and our hotel was great would be here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable & convienient, what more could you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: stressheadmum
Reviews.Content: Myself & my husband spent easter weekend at the Wolcott & had a great time. The room was cleaned daily, fresh towels every day & the bed was very comfortable, staff were very helpful & attentive. Coffee and muffins were ideal to get you ready for the day ahead. View from the window was not great but we didn't go to stay in the room. I would definetely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “DNS: Dirty, Noisy, Small”
Reviews.Author: delos1970
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in a hotel close to the center of NY and found Wolcott Hotel which was advertised to be renovated and clean. Well, the entrance hall indeed was nicely refurbished in a pompous old style. But the entrance hall is not were you sleep or take a shower. The rooms were small, not exactly dirty but grubby, and the beds quite unconfortable. If you are claustrophobic you cannot take a shower in this hotel. If you prefere to take a warm shower go to a spa somewhere in NewYork. If there even is water comming out of the shower head it is either ice cold or burning hot. Flushing the toilet led to blockage almost every time. The quality of service is differing. The room maid was friendly and gave us an extra blanket so two of us could sleep at least some hours in the micro beds. Checking in, the concierge didn´t want to find our reservation until I finally found the printout of the online booking and could proof it. Still we were given single rooms though booking rooms with two beds. Hotels in NY can obviously choose their guests. The breakfast consisted of a muffin and the most American coffee I ever had to taste (you know what I mean!). There was no restaurant just some seats in most cases occupied by kids running around in the hotel during the night. This couldn´t bother me though as the windows let all the noise from NYPD blue inside. To be serious: choose this hotel only if you don´t find a cheaper one!

Reviews.Title: “Too pricey, very basic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jessietan
